   20: -module(compile_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: %% Tests compile:file/1 and compile:file/2 with various options.
   23: 
   24: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   25: -include_lib("stdlib/include/erl_compile.hrl").
   26: 
   27: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   28: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   29: 	 app_test/1,appup_test/1,bigE_roundtrip/1,
   30: 	 debug_info/4, custom_debug_info/1, custom_compile_info/1,
   31: 	 file_1/1, forms_2/1, module_mismatch/1, outdir/1,
   32: 	 binary/1, makedep/1, cond_and_ifdef/1, listings/1, listings_big/1,
   33: 	 other_output/1, encrypted_abstr/1,
   34: 	 strict_record/1, utf8_atoms/1, utf8_functions/1, extra_chunks/1,
   35: 	 cover/1, env/1, core_pp/1, tuple_calls/1,
   36: 	 core_roundtrip/1, asm/1, asm_labels/1,
   37: 	 sys_pre_attributes/1, dialyzer/1, no_core_prepare/1,
   38:          beam_ssa_pp_smoke_test/1,
   39: 	 warnings/1, pre_load_check/1, env_compiler_options/1,
   40:          bc_options/1, deterministic_include/1, deterministic_paths/1,
   41:          deterministic_docs/1,
   42:          compile_attribute/1, message_printing/1, other_options/1,
   43:          transforms/1, erl_compile_api/1, types_pp/1, bs_init_writable/1,
   44:          annotations_pp/1, option_order/1
   45: 	]).
   46: 
   47: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   48: 
   49: %% To cover the stripping of 'type' and 'spec' in beam_asm.
   50: -type all_return_type() :: [atom()].
   51: -spec all() -> all_return_type().
   52: 
   53: all() -> 
   54:     [app_test, appup_test, bigE_roundtrip, file_1,
   55:      forms_2, module_mismatch, outdir,
   56:      binary, makedep, cond_and_ifdef, listings, listings_big,
   57:      other_output, encrypted_abstr, tuple_calls,
   58:      strict_record, utf8_atoms, utf8_functions, extra_chunks,
   59:      cover, env, core_pp, core_roundtrip, asm, asm_labels, no_core_prepare,
   60:      sys_pre_attributes, dialyzer, beam_ssa_pp_smoke_test,
   61:      warnings, pre_load_check,
   62:      env_compiler_options, custom_debug_info, bc_options,
   63:      custom_compile_info, deterministic_include, deterministic_paths,
   64:      deterministic_docs,
   65:      compile_attribute, message_printing, other_options, transforms,
   66:      erl_compile_api, types_pp, bs_init_writable, annotations_pp,
   67:      option_order].
   68: 
   69: groups() -> 
   70:     [].
   71: 
   72: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   73:     test_lib:recompile(?MODULE),
   74:     Config.
   75: 
   76: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   77:     ok.
   78: 
   79: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   80: 	Config.
   81: 
   82: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   83: 	Config.
   84: 
   85: 
   86: 
   87: %% Test that the Application file has no `basic' errors.";
   88: app_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   89:     test_server:app_test(compiler).
   90: 
   91: %% Test that the Application upgrade file has no `basic' errors.";
   92: appup_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   93:     ok = test_server:appup_test(compiler).
   94: 
   95: %% Check that a file compiled to the abstract form and dumped with -E
   96: %% can be compiled. We use a file constructed to produce errors if the
   97: %% dumping fails to legalize compiler generated variable names.
   98: bigE_roundtrip(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   99:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  100:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  101:     Source = filename:join(DataDir, "bigE.erl"),
  102:     TargetDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "bigE"),
  103:     Target = filename:join(TargetDir, "bigE.E"),
  104:     TargetSource = filename:join(TargetDir, "bigE.erl"),
  105:     ok = file:make_dir(TargetDir),
  106:     io:format("Source: ~p~nTargetDir: ~p~nTarget: ~p\n",
  107:               [Source, TargetDir, Target]),
  108:     case compile:file(Source,
  109:                       ['E', warnings_as_errors, {outdir, TargetDir}]) of
  110:         {ok, _} -> ok;
  111:         Other -> ct:fail({unexpected_result, Other})
  112:     end,
  113:     %% Rename the output to .erl so that the compiler accepts it and
  114:     %% we won't get a warning due to the filename not matching the
  115:     %% module name.
  116:     ok = file:rename(Target, TargetSource),
  117:     case compile:file(TargetSource,
  118:                       [warnings_as_errors, {outdir, TargetDir}]) of
  119:         {ok, _} -> ok;
  120:         Other1 -> ct:fail({unexpected_result, Other1})
  121:     end,
  122:     file:delete(TargetSource),
  123:     file:del_dir(TargetDir),
  124:     ok.
  125: 
  126: %% Tests that we can compile and run a simple Erlang program,
  127: %% using compile:file/1.
  128: 
  129: file_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  130:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  131: 
  132:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  133:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  134: 
  135:     {Simple, Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "file_1"),
  136:     {ok, Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
  137:     ok = file:set_cwd(filename:dirname(Target)),
  138: 
  139:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [slim]), %Smoke test only.
  140:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple),	%Smoke test only.
  141: 
  142:     compile_and_verify(Simple, Target, []),
  143:     compile_and_verify(Simple, Target, [debug_info]),
  144:     compile_and_verify(Simple, Target, [no_postopt]),
  145: 
  146:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [no_line_info]), %Coverage
  147:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [{eprof,beam_z}]), %Coverage
  148:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [{call_time,beam_z}]), %Coverage
  149:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [{call_memory,beam_z}]), %Coverage
  150: 
  151:     %% Cover option not in a list (undocumented feature).
  152:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, no_postopt),
  153: 
  154:     %% Test compiling from an .abstr file.
  155:     {ok,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [dabstr]),
  156:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(filename:rootname(Target), [from_abstr]),
  157:     ok = file:delete(filename:rootname(Target) ++ ".abstr"),
  158: 
  159:     %% Test option 'deterministic'.
  160:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [deterministic]),
  161:     {module,simple} = c:l(simple),
  162:     [{version,_}] = simple:module_info(compile),
  163:     true = code:delete(simple),
  164:     false = code:purge(simple),
  165: 
  166:     ok = file:set_cwd(Cwd),
  167:     true = exists(Target),
  168:     passed = run(Target, test, []),
  169: 
  170:     %% Test option 'deterministic' as a compiler attribute.
  171:     Det = deterministic_module,
  172:     {DetPath, DetTarget} = get_files(Config, Det, "det_target"),
  173:     {ok,Det,DetCode} = compile:file(DetPath, [binary]),
  174:     {module,Det} = code:load_binary(Det, "", DetCode),
  175:     [{version,_}] = Det:module_info(compile),
  176:     true = code:delete(Det),
  177:     false = code:purge(Det),
  178: 
  179:     %% Cover error handling code.
  180:     NonExisting = definitely__no__such__module,
  181:     error = compile:file(NonExisting, [report]),
  182:     error = compile:file(NonExisting, [from_abstr,report]),
  183:     error = compile:file(NonExisting, [from_core,report]),
  184:     error = compile:file(NonExisting, [from_asm,report]),
  185: 
  186:     error = compile:file(filename:join(DataDir, "bad_core"), [from_core,report]),
  187:     error = compile:file(filename:join(DataDir, "bad_core_tokens"), [from_core,report]),
  188: 
  189:     %% Cover handling of obsolete options.
  190:     ObsoleteOptions = [r18,r19,r20,r21,r22,r23,
  191:                        no_bsm3,no_get_hd_tl,no_put_tuple2,no_utf8_atoms,
  192:                        no_swap,no_init_yregs,no_shared_fun_wrappers,no_make_fun3],
  193:     _ = [begin
  194:              {error,[{_Simple,
  195:                       [{none,compile,{obsolete_option,Opt}}]}],
  196:               []} =
  197:                  compile:file(Simple, [Opt,return]),
  198:              error = compile:file(Simple, [Opt,report])
  199:          end || Opt <- ObsoleteOptions],
  200: 
  201:     %% Create a directory with the same name as the temp file to cover
  202:     %% handling of write errors.
  203:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, "simple"),
  204:     SimpleTempFile = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple.bea#"),
  205:     SimpleOutputFile = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple.beam"),
  206:     ok = file:make_dir(SimpleTempFile),
  207:     ok = file:make_dir(SimpleOutputFile),
  208:     try
  209:         error = compile:file(Simple, [{outdir,PrivDir}, report]),
  210:         _ = file:del_dir(SimpleTempFile),
  211:         error = compile:file(Simple, [{outdir,PrivDir}, report])
  212:     after
  213:         _ = file:del_dir(SimpleTempFile),
  214:         _ = file:del_dir(SimpleOutputFile)
  215:     end,
  216: 
  217:     %% Cleanup.
  218:     ok = file:delete(Target),
  219:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  220:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(DetTarget)),
  221: 
  222:     %% There should not be any messages in the messages.
  223:     receive
  224: 	Any ->
  225: 	    ct:fail({unexpected,Any})
  226:     after 10 ->
  227: 	    ok
  228:     end,
  229: 
  230:     ok.
  231: 
  232: forms_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  233:     {Simple, Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "file_1"),
  234:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  235: 
  236:     Src = Simple,
  237:     AbsSrc = filename:absname(Src),
  238:     {ok,[],SimpleCode} = compile:file(Simple, [dabstr,binary]),
  239: 
  240:     {ok,simple,Bin1} = compile:forms(SimpleCode, [binary,{source,Src}]),
  241:     {ok,simple,_} = compile:forms(SimpleCode,
  242:                                   [binary,{error_location,line},{source,Src}]),
  243: 
  244:     %% Cover option not in a list (undocumented feature).
  245:     {ok,simple,_} = compile:forms(SimpleCode, no_postopt),
  246: 
  247:     %% Load and test that the proper source is returned.
  248:     AbsSrc = forms_load_code(simple, Src, Bin1),
  249: 
  250:     %% Work in a deleted directory.
  251:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  252:     WorkDir = filename:join(PrivDir, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  253:     ok = file:make_dir(WorkDir),
  254:     ok = file:set_cwd(WorkDir),
  255:     case os:type() of
  256: 	{unix,_} -> os:cmd("rm -rf " ++ WorkDir);
  257: 	_ -> ok
  258:     end,
  259:     {ok,simple,Bin2} = compile:forms(SimpleCode),
  260:     undefined = forms_load_code(simple, "ignore", Bin2),
  261: 
  262:     {ok,simple,Bin3} = compile:forms(SimpleCode, [{source,Src},report]),
  263:     case forms_load_code(simple, "ignore", Bin3) of
  264: 	Src ->					%Unix.
  265: 	    ok;
  266: 	AbsSrc ->				%Windows.
  267: 	    ok
  268:     end,
  269: 
  270:     {ok,simple,Core} = compile:forms(SimpleCode, [to_core0,binary]),
  271:     forms_compile_and_load(Core, [from_core]),
  272: 
  273:     {ok,simple,Asm} = compile:forms(SimpleCode, [to_asm,binary]),
  274:     forms_compile_and_load(Asm, [from_asm]),
  275: 
  276:     %% The `from_abstr` option is redundant when compiling from forms,
  277:     %% but it should work.
  278:     forms_compile_and_load(SimpleCode, [from_abstr]),
  279: 
  280:     %% Cover the error handling code.
  281:     error = compile:forms(bad_core, [from_core,report]),
  282:     error = compile:forms(bad_asm, [from_asm,report]),
  283: 
  284:     ok.
  285: 
  286: 
  287: forms_load_code(Mod, Src, Bin) ->
  288:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, Src, Bin),
  289:     Info = Mod:module_info(compile),
  290:     SourceOption = proplists:get_value(source, Info),
  291: 
  292:     %% Ensure that the options are not polluted with 'source'.
  293:     [] = proplists:get_value(options, Info),
  294: 
  295:     %% Cleanup.
  296:     true = code:delete(simple),
  297:     false = code:purge(simple),
  298: 
  299:     SourceOption.
  300: 
  301: forms_compile_and_load(Code, Opts) ->
  302:     Mod = simple,
  303:     {ok,Mod,Bin} = compile:forms(Code, Opts),
  304:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "ignore", Bin),
  305:     _ = Mod:module_info(),
  306:     true = code:delete(simple),
  307:     false = code:purge(simple),
  308:     ok.
  309: 
  310: module_mismatch(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  311:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  312:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "wrong_module_name.erl"),
  313:     {error,[{"wrong_module_name.beam",
  314: 	     [{none,compile,{module_name,arne,"wrong_module_name"}}]}],
  315: 	   []} = compile:file(File, [return]),
  316:     error = compile:file(File, [report]),
  317: 
  318:     {ok,arne,[]} = compile:file(File,
  319: 				      [return,no_error_module_mismatch]),
  320: 
  321:     ok.
  322: 
  323: %% Tests that the {outdir, Dir} option works.
  324: 
  325: outdir(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  326:     {Simple, Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "outdir"),
  327:     {ok, simple} = compile:file(Simple, [{outdir, filename:dirname(Target)}]),
  328:     true = exists(Target),
  329:     passed = run(Target, test, []),
  330:     ok = file:delete(Target),
  331:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  332:     ok.
  333: 
  334: %% Tests that the binary option works.
  335: 
  336: binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  337:     {Simple, Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "binary"),
  338:     {ok, simple, Binary} = compile:file(Simple, [binary]),
  339:     code:load_binary(simple, Target, Binary),
  340:     passed = simple:test(),
  341:     true = code:delete(simple),
  342:     false = code:purge(simple),
  343:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  344:     ok.
  345: 
  346: %% Tests that the dependencies-Makefile-related options work.
  347: 
  348: makedep(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  349:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  350:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  351: 
  352:     {Simple,Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "makedep"),
  353:     SimpleRootname = filename:rootname(Simple),
  354:     IncludeDir = filename:join(filename:dirname(Simple), "include"),
  355:     IncludeOptions = [
  356: 		      {d,need_foo},
  357: 		      {d,foo_value,42},
  358: 		      {d,include_generated},
  359: 		      {i,IncludeDir}
  360: 		     ],
  361: 
  362:     %% Basic rule.
  363:     BasicMf1Name = SimpleRootname ++ "-basic1.mk",
  364:     {ok,BasicMf1} = file:read_file(BasicMf1Name),
  365:     {ok,_,Mf1} = compile:file(Simple, [binary,makedep]),
  366:     BasicMf1 = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf1, DataDir),
  367: 
  368:     %% Basic rule with one existing header.
  369:     BasicMf2Name = SimpleRootname ++ "-basic2.mk",
  370:     {ok,BasicMf2} = file:read_file(BasicMf2Name),
  371:     {ok,_,Mf2} = compile:file(Simple, [binary,makedep|IncludeOptions]),
  372:     BasicMf2 = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf2, DataDir),
  373: 
  374:     %% Rule with one existing header and one missing header.
  375:     MissingMfName = SimpleRootname ++ "-missing.mk",
  376:     {ok,MissingMf} = file:read_file(MissingMfName),
  377:     {ok,_,Mf3} = compile:file(Simple,
  378:       [binary,makedep,makedep_add_missing|IncludeOptions]),
  379:     MissingMf = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf3, DataDir),
  380: 
  381:     %% Rule with modified target.
  382:     TargetMf1Name = SimpleRootname ++ "-target1.mk",
  383:     {ok,TargetMf1} = file:read_file(TargetMf1Name),
  384:     {ok,_,Mf4} = compile:file(Simple,
  385:       [binary,makedep,{makedep_target,"$target"}|IncludeOptions]),
  386:     TargetMf1 = makedep_modify_target(
  387:       makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf4, DataDir), "$$target"),
  388: 
  389:     %% Rule with quoted modified target.
  390:     TargetMf2Name = SimpleRootname ++ "-target2.mk",
  391:     {ok,TargetMf2} = file:read_file(TargetMf2Name),
  392:     {ok,_,Mf5} = compile:file(Simple,
  393:       [binary,makedep,{makedep_target,"$target"},makedep_quote_target|
  394:         IncludeOptions]),
  395:     TargetMf2 = makedep_modify_target(
  396:       makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf5, DataDir), "$$target"),
  397: 
  398:     %% Basic rule written to some file.
  399:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Simple,
  400:       [makedep,{makedep_output,Target}|IncludeOptions]),
  401:     {ok,Mf6} = file:read_file(Target),
  402:     BasicMf2 = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf6, DataDir),
  403: 
  404:     %% Rule with creating phony target.
  405:     PhonyMfName = SimpleRootname ++ "-phony.mk",
  406:     {ok,PhonyMf} = file:read_file(PhonyMfName),
  407:     {ok,_,Mf7} = compile:file(Simple,
  408:       [binary,makedep,makedep_phony|IncludeOptions]),
  409:     PhonyMf = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf7, DataDir),
  410: 
  411:     %% Basic rule written to the default file.
  412:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Simple, [makedep|IncludeOptions]),
  413:     {ok,Mf8} = file:read_file(Target),
  414:     BasicMf2 = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf8, DataDir),
  415: 
  416:     %% Generate dependencies and compile normally at the same time.
  417:     GeneratedHrl = filename:join(PrivDir, "generated.hrl"),
  418:     GeneratedDoc = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "foo.md"),
  419:     try
  420:         ok = file:write_file(GeneratedHrl, ""),
  421:         ok = file:write_file(GeneratedDoc, ""),
  422:         {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [report,makedep_side_effect,
  423:                                             {makedep_output,Target},
  424:                                             {i,PrivDir}|IncludeOptions]),
  425:         {ok,Mf9} = file:read_file(Target),
  426:         BasicMf3 = iolist_to_binary([string:trim(BasicMf2), " $(srcdir)/foo.md ", filename:join(PrivDir, "generated.hrl"), "\n"]),
  427:         BasicMf3 = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf9, DataDir),
  428:         error = compile:file(Simple, [report,makedep_side_effect,
  429:                                       {makedep_output,PrivDir}|IncludeOptions])
  430:     after
  431:         ok = file:delete(GeneratedHrl),
  432:         ok = file:delete(GeneratedDoc)
  433:     end,
  434: 
  435:     %% Cover generation of long lines that must be split.
  436:     CompileModule = filename:join(code:lib_dir(compiler), "src/compile.erl"),
  437:     {ok,_} = compile:file(CompileModule, [report,
  438:                                           makedep,{makedep_output,standard_io},
  439:                                           {i,filename:join(code:lib_dir(stdlib), "include")}]),
  440: 
  441:     %% Basic rule written to the standard output.
  442:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Simple, [makedep,{makedep_output,standard_io}|IncludeOptions]),
  443: 
  444:     %% Test error handling.
  445:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report,makedep,{makedep_output,DataDir}]),
  446:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report,makedep,{makedep_output,a_bad_output_device}]),
  447: 
  448:     ok = file:delete(Target),
  449:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  450:     ok.
  451: 
  452: makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf, DataDir) ->
  453:     Mf0 = binary_to_list(Mf),
  454:     %% Replace the Datadir by "$(srcdir)".
  455:     Mf1 = re:replace(Mf0, DataDir, "$(srcdir)/",
  456:       [global,multiline,{return,list}]),
  457:     %% Long lines are split, put back everything on one line.
  458:     Mf2 = re:replace(Mf1, "\\\\\n  ", "", [global,multiline,{return,list}]),
  459:     list_to_binary(Mf2).
  460: 
  461: makedep_modify_target(Mf, Target) ->
  462:     Mf0 = binary_to_list(Mf),
  463:     Mf1 = re:replace(Mf0, Target, "$target", [{return,list}]),
  464:     list_to_binary(Mf1).
  465: 
  466: %% Tests that conditional compilation, defining values, including files work.
  467: 
  468: no_core_prepare(_Config) ->
  469:     Mod = {c_module,[],
  470:               {c_literal,[],sample_receive},
  471:               [{c_var,[],{discard,0}}],
  472:               [],
  473:               [{{c_var,[],{discard,0}},
  474:                 {c_fun,[],[],
  475:                     {c_case,[],
  476:                         {c_values,[],[]},
  477:                         [{c_clause,[],[],
  478:                              {c_literal,[],true},
  479:                              {c_receive,[],[],{c_literal,[],0},{c_literal,[],ok}}}]}}}]},
  480: 
  481:     {ok,sample_receive,_,_} = compile:forms(Mod, [from_core,binary,return]),
  482:     {error,_,_} = compile:forms(Mod, [from_core,binary,return,no_core_prepare]),
  483:     ok.
  484: 
  485: cond_and_ifdef(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  486:     {Simple, Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "cond_and_ifdef"),
  487:     IncludeDir = filename:join(filename:dirname(Simple), "include"),
  488:     Options = [{outdir, filename:dirname(Target)},
  489: 		     {d, need_foo}, {d, foo_value, 42},
  490: 		     {i, IncludeDir}, report],
  491:     {ok, simple} = compile:file(Simple, Options),
  492:     true = exists(Target),
  493:     {hiker, 42} = run(Target, foo, []),
  494:     ok = file:delete(Target),
  495:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  496:     ok.
  497: 
  498: listings(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  499:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  500:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  501:     ok = do_file_listings(DataDir, PrivDir, [
  502: 	    "simple",
  503: 	    "small",
  504: 	    "small_maps"
  505: 	]),
  506: 
  507:     %% Cover handling of write errors.
  508:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, "simple"),
  509:     SimpleTarget = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple.S"),
  510:     ok = file:make_dir(SimpleTarget),
  511:     try
  512:         error = compile:file(Simple, ['S', {outdir,PrivDir}, report])
  513:     after
  514:         ok = file:del_dir(SimpleTarget)
  515:     end,
  516: 
  517:     ok.
  518: 
  519: do_file_listings(_, _, []) -> ok;
  520: do_file_listings(DataDir, PrivDir, [File|Files]) ->
  521:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, File),
  522:     TargetDir = filename:join(PrivDir, listings),
  523:     ok = file:make_dir(TargetDir),
  524: 
  525:     List = [{'S',".S"},
  526:             {'E',".E"},
  527:             {'P',".P"},
  528:             {dpp, ".pp"},
  529:             {dabstr, ".abstr"},
  530:             {dexp, ".expand"},
  531:             {dcore, ".core"},
  532:             {doldinline, ".oldinline"},
  533:             {dinline, ".inline"},
  534:             {dcore, ".core"},
  535:             {dcopt, ".copt"},
  536:             {dcbsm, ".core_bsm"},
  537:             {dssa, ".ssa"},
  538:             {dbool, ".bool"},
  539:             {dssashare, ".ssashare"},
  540:             {dssaopt, ".ssaopt"},
  541:             {dprecg, ".precodegen"},
  542:             {dcg, ".codegen"},
  543:             {dblk, ".block"},
  544:             {djmp, ".jump"},
  545:             {dclean, ".clean"},
  546:             {dopt, ".optimize"},
  547:             {diffable, ".S"}],
  548:     p_listings(List, Simple, TargetDir),
  549: 
  550:     %% Test options that produce a listing file if 'binary' is not given.
  551:     do_listing(Simple, TargetDir, to_pp, ".P"),
  552:     do_listing(Simple, TargetDir, to_exp, ".E"),
  553:     do_listing(Simple, TargetDir, to_core0, ".core"),
  554:     ok = file:delete(filename:join(TargetDir, File ++ ".core")),
  555:     do_listing(Simple, TargetDir, to_core, ".core"),
  556:     do_listing(Simple, TargetDir, to_dis, ".dis"),
  557: 
  558:     %% Final clean up.
  559:     lists:foreach(fun(F) -> ok = file:delete(F) end,
  560: 	filelib:wildcard(filename:join(TargetDir, "*"))),
  561:     ok = file:del_dir(TargetDir),
  562: 
  563:     do_file_listings(DataDir,PrivDir,Files).
  564: 
  565: listings_big(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  566:     {Big,Target} = get_files(Config, big, listings_big),
  567:     TargetDir = filename:dirname(Target),
  568:     List = [{'S',".S"},
  569:             {'E',".E"},
  570:             {'P',".P"},
  571:             {dssa, ".ssa"},
  572:             {dssaopt, ".ssaopt"},
  573:             {dprecg, ".precodegen"},
  574:             {to_dis, ".dis"}],
  575:     p_listings(List, Big, TargetDir).
  576: 
  577: p_listings(List, File, BaseDir) ->
  578:     Run = fun({Option,Extension}) ->
  579:                   Uniq = erlang:unique_integer([positive]),
  580:                   Dir = filename:join(BaseDir, integer_to_list(Uniq)),
  581:                   ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  582:                   try
  583:                       do_listing(File, Dir, Option, Extension),
  584:                       ok
  585:                   catch
  586:                       Class:Error:Stk ->
  587:                           io:format("~p:~p\n~p\n", [Class,Error,Stk]),
  588:                           error
  589:                   after
  590:                       _ = [ok = file:delete(F) ||
  591:                               F <- filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Dir, "*"))],
  592:                       ok = file:del_dir(Dir)
  593:                   end
  594:           end,
  595:     test_lib:p_run(Run, List).
  596: 
  597: other_output(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  598:     {Simple,_Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "other_output"),
  599: 
  600:     io:put_chars("to_pp"),
  601:     {ok,[],PP} = compile:file(Simple, [to_pp,binary,time]),
  602:     [] = [E || E <- PP,
  603: 	       begin
  604: 		   case element(1, E) of
  605: 		       attribute -> false;
  606: 		       function -> false;
  607: 		       eof -> false
  608: 		   end
  609: 	       end],
  610: 
  611:     io:put_chars("to_exp (file)"),
  612:     {ok,[],Expand} = compile:file(Simple, [to_exp,binary,time]),
  613:     true = is_list(Expand),
  614:     {attribute,_,module,simple} = lists:keyfind(module, 3, Expand),
  615:     io:put_chars("to_exp (forms)"),
  616:     {ok,[],Expand} = compile:forms(PP, [to_exp,binary,time]),
  617: 
  618:     io:put_chars("to_core (file)"),
  619:     {ok,simple,Core} = compile:file(Simple, [to_core,binary,time]),
  620:     c_module = element(1, Core),
  621:     {ok,_} = core_lint:module(Core),
  622:     io:put_chars("to_core (forms)"),
  623:     {ok,simple,Core} = compile:forms(PP, [to_core,binary,time]),
  624: 
  625:     io:put_chars("to_asm (file)"),
  626:     {ok,simple,Asm} = compile:file(Simple, [to_asm,binary,time]),
  627:     {simple,_,_,_,_} = Asm,
  628:     io:put_chars("to_asm (forms)"),
  629:     {ok,simple,Asm} = compile:forms(PP, [to_asm,binary,time]),
  630: 
  631:     ok.
  632: 
  633: encrypted_abstr(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  634:     {Simple,Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "encrypted_abstr"),
  635: 
  636:     Res = case has_crypto() of
  637: 	      false ->
  638: 		  %% No crypto.
  639: 		  encrypted_abstr_no_crypto(Simple, Target),
  640: 		  {comment,"The crypto application is missing or broken"};
  641: 	      true ->
  642: 		  %% Simulate not having crypto by removing
  643: 		  %% the crypto application from the path.
  644: 		  OldPath = code:get_path(),
  645: 		  try
  646: 		      NewPath = OldPath -- [filename:dirname(code:which(crypto))],
  647: 		      (catch crypto:stop()),
  648: 		      code:delete(crypto),
  649: 		      code:purge(crypto),
  650: 		      code:set_path(NewPath),
  651: 		      encrypted_abstr_no_crypto(Simple, Target)
  652: 		      after
  653: 			  code:set_path(OldPath)
  654: 		      end,
  655: 
  656: 		  %% Now run the tests that require crypto.
  657: 		  encrypted_abstr_1(Simple, Target),
  658: 		  ok = file:delete(Target),
  659: 		  _ = file:del_dir_r(filename:dirname(Target))
  660: 	  end,
  661:     
  662:     %% Cleanup.
  663:     Res.
  664: 
  665: encrypted_abstr_1(Simple, Target) ->
  666:     TargetDir = filename:dirname(Target),
  667:     Key = "ablurf123BX#$;3",
  668:     install_crypto_key(Key),
  669:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple,
  670: 				     [debug_info,{debug_info_key,Key},
  671: 				      {outdir,TargetDir}]),
  672:     verify_abstract(Target, erl_abstract_code),
  673: 
  674:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple,
  675: 				     [{debug_info_key,Key},
  676: 				      {outdir,TargetDir}]),
  677:     verify_abstract(Target, erl_abstract_code),
  678: 
  679:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple,
  680: 				     [debug_info,{debug_info_key,{des3_cbc,Key}},
  681: 				      {outdir,TargetDir}]),
  682:     verify_abstract(Target, erl_abstract_code),
  683: 
  684:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple,
  685: 				     [{debug_info,{?MODULE,ok}},
  686: 				      {debug_info_key,Key},
  687: 				      {outdir,TargetDir}]),
  688:     verify_abstract(Target, ?MODULE),
  689: 
  690:     {ok,{simple,[{compile_info,CInfo}]}} =
  691: 	beam_lib:chunks(Target, [compile_info]),
  692:     {_,Opts} = lists:keyfind(options, 1, CInfo),
  693:     {_,'********'} = lists:keyfind(debug_info_key, 1, Opts),
  694: 
  695:     %% Try some illegal forms of crypto keys.
  696:     error = compile:file(Simple,
  697: 			       [debug_info,{debug_info_key,{blurf,"ss"}},report]),
  698:     error = compile:file(Simple,
  699: 			       [debug_info,{debug_info_key,{blurf,1,"ss"}},report]),
  700:     error = compile:file(Simple,
  701: 			       [debug_info,{debug_info_key,42},report]),
  702: 
  703:     beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  704: 
  705:     %% Test to place the crypto file on disk. The test is dependent on the
  706:     %% $HOME of the emulator, so we do this test in another node.
  707:     TestHome = filename:join(TargetDir, "home"),
  708:     filelib:ensure_dir(TestHome),
  709:     HomeEnv = case os:type() of
  710:                   {win32, _} ->
  711:                       [Drive | Path] = filename:split(TestHome),
  712:                       [{"APPDATA", filename:join(TestHome,"AppData")},
  713:                        {"HOMEDRIVE", Drive}, {"HOMEPATH", filename:join(Path)}];
  714:                   _ ->
  715:                       [{"HOME", TestHome}]
  716:               end,
  717: 
  718:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{ env => HomeEnv }),
  719: 
  720:     erpc:call(
  721:       Node,
  722:       fun() ->
  723:               ok = file:set_cwd(TargetDir),
  724: 
  725:               error = compile:file(Simple, [encrypt_debug_info,report]),
  726: 
  727:               CWDKey = "better use another key here",
  728:               CWDFile = ".erlang.crypt",
  729:               XDGKey = "better use yet another key here",
  730:               XDGFile = filename:join(
  731:                           filename:basedir(user_config,"erlang"),
  732:                           ".erlang.crypt"),
  733:               HOMEKey = "better use the home key here",
  734:               HOMEFile = filename:join(TestHome,".erlang.crypt"),
  735: 
  736:               write_crypt_file(CWDFile, CWDKey),
  737:               write_crypt_file(XDGFile, XDGKey),
  738:               write_crypt_file(HOMEFile, HOMEKey),
  739: 
  740:               %% First we test that .erlang.crypt in cwd works
  741:               {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [encrypt_debug_info,report]),
  742:               verify_abstract("simple.beam", erl_abstract_code),
  743:               ok = file:delete(CWDFile),
  744:               beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  745: 
  746:               %% Then we test that .erlang.crypt in HOME does **not** work
  747:               {error,beam_lib,{key_missing_or_invalid,"simple.beam",abstract_code}} =
  748:                   beam_lib:chunks("simple.beam", [abstract_code]),
  749: 
  750:               %% Then we test that .erlang.crypt in HOME does work
  751:               {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [encrypt_debug_info,report]),
  752:               verify_abstract("simple.beam", erl_abstract_code),
  753:               ok = file:delete(HOMEFile),
  754:               beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  755: 
  756:               %% Then we test that .erlang.crypt in XDG does **not** work
  757:               {error,beam_lib,{key_missing_or_invalid,"simple.beam",abstract_code}} =
  758:                   beam_lib:chunks("simple.beam", [abstract_code]),
  759: 
  760: 
  761:               %% Then we test that .erlang.crypt in XDG does work
  762:               {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [encrypt_debug_info,report]),
  763:               verify_abstract("simple.beam", erl_abstract_code),
  764:               ok = file:delete(XDGFile),
  765: 
  766:               beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  767:               {error,beam_lib,{key_missing_or_invalid,"simple.beam",abstract_code}} =
  768:                   beam_lib:chunks("simple.beam", [abstract_code])
  769: 
  770:       end),
  771: 
  772:     peer:stop(Peer),
  773: 
  774:     %% Test key compatibility by reading a BEAM file produced before
  775:     %% the update to the new crypto functions.
  776:     install_crypto_key("an old key"),
  777:     KeyCompat = filename:join(filename:dirname(Simple),
  778: 			      "key_compatibility"),
  779:     {ok,{key_compatibility,[Chunk]}} = beam_lib:chunks(KeyCompat,
  780: 						       [abstract_code]),
  781:     {abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,_}} = Chunk,
  782: 
  783:     ok.
  784: 
  785: write_crypt_file(File, Key) ->
  786:     Contents = ["[{debug_info,des3_cbc,simple,\"",Key,"\"}].\n"],
  787:     io:format("~s: ~s\n", [File, Contents]),
  788:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(File),
  789:     ok = file:write_file(File, Contents).
  790: 
  791: encrypted_abstr_no_crypto(Simple, Target) ->
  792:     io:format("simpe: ~p~n", [Simple]),
  793:     TargetDir = filename:dirname(Target),
  794:     Key = "ablurf123BX#$;3",
  795:     error = compile:file(Simple,
  796: 			       [debug_info,{debug_info_key,Key},
  797: 				{outdir,TargetDir},report]),
  798:     ok.
  799:     
  800: verify_abstract(Beam, Backend) ->
  801:     {ok,{simple,[Abst, Dbgi]}} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code, debug_info]),
  802:     {abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,_}} = Abst,
  803:     {debug_info,{debug_info_v1,Backend,_}} = Dbgi.
  804: 
  805: has_crypto() ->
  806:     try
  807: 	crypto:start(),
  808: 	crypto:stop(),
  809: 	true
  810:     catch
  811: 	error:_ -> false
  812:     end.
  813: 
  814: install_crypto_key(Key) ->
  815:     F = fun (init) -> ok;
  816: 	    ({debug_info,des3_cbc,_,_}) -> Key;
  817: 	    (clear) -> ok
  818: 	end,
  819:     ok = beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(F).
  820: 
  821: %% Miscellaneous tests, mainly to get better coverage.
  822: debug_info(erlang_v1, Module, ok, _Opts) ->
  823:     {ok, [Module]};
  824: debug_info(erlang_v1, _Module, error, _Opts) ->
  825:     {error, unknown_format}.
  826: 
  827: custom_debug_info(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  828:     {Simple,_} = get_files(Config, simple, "file_1"),
  829: 
  830:     {ok,simple,OkBin} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, {debug_info,{?MODULE,ok}}]), %Coverage
  831:     {ok,{simple,[{abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,[simple]}}]}} =
  832: 	beam_lib:chunks(OkBin, [abstract_code]),
  833:     {ok,{simple,[{debug_info,{debug_info_v1,?MODULE,ok}}]}} =
  834: 	beam_lib:chunks(OkBin, [debug_info]),
  835: 
  836:     {ok,simple,ErrorBin} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, {debug_info,{?MODULE,error}}]), %Coverage
  837:     {ok,{simple,[{abstract_code,no_abstract_code}]}} =
  838: 	beam_lib:chunks(ErrorBin, [abstract_code]),
  839:     {ok,{simple,[{debug_info,{debug_info_v1,?MODULE,error}}]}} =
  840: 	beam_lib:chunks(ErrorBin, [debug_info]).
  841: 
  842: custom_compile_info(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  843:     Anno = erl_anno:new(1),
  844:     Forms = [{attribute,Anno,module,custom_compile_info}],
  845:     Opts = [binary,{compile_info,[{another,version}]}],
  846: 
  847:     {ok,custom_compile_info,Bin} = compile:forms(Forms, Opts),
  848:     {ok,{custom_compile_info,[{compile_info,CompileInfo}]}} =
  849: 	beam_lib:chunks(Bin, [compile_info]),
  850:     version = proplists:get_value(another, CompileInfo),
  851:     CompileOpts = proplists:get_value(options, CompileInfo),
  852:     undefined = proplists:get_value(compile_info, CompileOpts),
  853: 
  854:     {ok,custom_compile_info,DetBin} = compile:forms(Forms, [deterministic|Opts]),
  855:     {ok,{custom_compile_info,[{compile_info,DetInfo}]}} =
  856: 	beam_lib:chunks(DetBin, [compile_info]),
  857:     version = proplists:get_value(another, DetInfo).
  858: 
  859: cover(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  860:     io:format("~p\n", [compile:options()]),
  861:     ok.
  862: 
  863: do_listing(Source, TargetDir, Type, Ext) ->
  864:     io:format("Source: ~p TargetDir: ~p\n  Type: ~p Ext: ~p\n",
  865: 	      [Source, TargetDir, Type, Ext]),
  866:     case compile:file(Source, [Type, time, {outdir, TargetDir}]) of
  867: 	{ok, _} -> ok;
  868: 	Other -> ct:fail({unexpected_result, Other})
  869:     end,
  870:     SourceBase = filename:rootname(filename:basename(Source)),
  871: 
  872:     Target = filename:join(TargetDir, SourceBase ++ Ext),
  873:     true = exists(Target).
  874: 
  875: get_files(Config, Module, OutputName) ->
  876:     code:delete(Module),
  877:     code:purge(Module),
  878:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  879:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  880:     Src = filename:join(DataDir, atom_to_list(Module)),
  881:     TargetDir = filename:join(PrivDir, OutputName),
  882:     ok = file:make_dir(TargetDir),
  883:     File = atom_to_list(Module) ++ code:objfile_extension(),
  884:     Target = filename:join(TargetDir, File),
  885:     {Src, Target}.
  886: 
  887: run(Target, Func, Args) ->
  888:     Module = list_to_atom(filename:rootname(filename:basename(Target))),
  889:     {module, Module} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(Target)),
  890:     Result = (catch apply(Module, Func, Args)),
  891:     true = code:delete(Module),
  892:     false = code:purge(Module),
  893:     Result.
  894: 
  895: exists(Name) ->
  896:     case file:read_file_info(Name) of
  897: 	{ok, _}    -> true;
  898: 	{error, _} -> false
  899:     end.
  900: 
  901: 
  902: strict_record(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  903:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  904:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config)),
  905:     Opts = [{outdir,Priv},report_errors],
  906:     M = record_access,
  907:  
  908:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [strict_record_tests|Opts]),
  909:     Turtle = test_strict(),
  910: 
  911:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [no_strict_record_tests|Opts]),
  912:     Turtle = test_sloppy(),
  913: 
  914:     %% The option last given wins.
  915:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [strict_record_tests,no_strict_record_tests|Opts]),
  916:     Turtle = test_sloppy(),
  917:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [no_strict_record_tests,strict_record_tests|Opts]),
  918:     Turtle = test_strict(),
  919: 
  920:     %% Default (possibly influenced by ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS).
  921:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [{outdir,Priv},report_errors]),
  922:     try
  923:         {1,2} = record_access:test(Turtle),
  924:         {comment,"Default: no_strict_record_tests"}
  925:     catch
  926:         error:{badrecord,Turtle} ->
  927:             {comment,"Default: strict_record_tests"}
  928:     end.
  929: 
  930: test_strict() ->
  931:     Turtle = record_access:turtle(),
  932:     try
  933:         record_access:test(Turtle)
  934:     catch
  935:         error:{badrecord,Turtle} ->
  936:             ok
  937:     end,
  938:     Turtle.
  939: 
  940: test_sloppy() ->
  941:     Turtle = record_access:turtle(),
  942:     {1,2} = record_access:test(Turtle),
  943:     Turtle.
  944: 
  945: utf8_atoms(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  946:     Anno = erl_anno:new(1),
  947:     Atom = binary_to_atom(<<"こんにちは"/utf8>>, utf8),
  948:     Forms = [{attribute,Anno,compile,[export_all]},
  949: 	     {function,Anno,atom,0,[{clause,Anno,[],[],[{atom,Anno,Atom}]}]}],
  950: 
  951:     Utf8AtomForms = [{attribute,Anno,module,utf8_atom}|Forms],
  952:     {ok,utf8_atom,Utf8AtomBin} =
  953: 	compile:forms(Utf8AtomForms, [binary]),
  954:     {ok,{utf8_atom,[{atoms,_}]}} =
  955: 	beam_lib:chunks(Utf8AtomBin, [atoms]),
  956:     code:load_binary(utf8_atom, "compile_SUITE", Utf8AtomBin),
  957:     Atom = utf8_atom:atom(),
  958:     true = is_atom(Atom),
  959:     ok.
  960: 
  961: utf8_functions(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  962:     Anno = erl_anno:new(1),
  963:     Atom = binary_to_atom(<<"こんにちは"/utf8>>, utf8),
  964:     Forms = [{attribute,Anno,compile,[export_all]},
  965: 	     {function,Anno,Atom,0,[{clause,Anno,[],[],[{atom,Anno,world}]}]}],
  966: 
  967:     Utf8FunctionForms = [{attribute,Anno,module,utf8_function}|Forms],
  968:     {ok,utf8_function,Utf8FunctionBin} =
  969: 	compile:forms(Utf8FunctionForms, [binary]),
  970:     {ok,{utf8_function,[{atoms,_}]}} =
  971: 	beam_lib:chunks(Utf8FunctionBin, [atoms]),
  972:     code:load_binary(utf8_function, "compile_SUITE", Utf8FunctionBin),
  973:     world = utf8_function:Atom(),
  974: 
  975:     NoUtf8FunctionForms = [{attribute,Anno,module,no_utf8_function}|Forms],
  976:     error = compile:forms(NoUtf8FunctionForms, [binary, r19]).
  977: 
  978: extra_chunks(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  979:     Anno = erl_anno:new(1),
  980:     Forms = [{attribute,Anno,module,extra_chunks}],
  981: 
  982:     {ok,extra_chunks,ExtraChunksBinary} =
  983: 	compile:forms(Forms, [binary, {extra_chunks, [{<<"ExCh">>, <<"Contents">>}]}]),
  984:     {ok,{extra_chunks,[{"ExCh",<<"Contents">>}]}} =
  985: 	beam_lib:chunks(ExtraChunksBinary, ["ExCh"]).
  986: 
  987: tuple_calls(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  988:     Anno = erl_anno:new(1),
  989:     Forms = [{attribute,Anno,export,[{size,1},{store,1}]},
  990: 	     {function,Anno,size,1,
  991: 	      [{clause,Anno,[{var,Anno,mod}],[],
  992: 	       [{call,Anno,{remote,Anno,{var,Anno,mod},{atom,Anno,size}},
  993:                  []}]}]},
  994: 	     {function,Anno,store,1,
  995: 	      [{clause,Anno,[{var,Anno,mod}],[],
  996: 	       [{call,Anno,{remote,Anno,{var,Anno,mod},{atom,Anno,store}},
  997:                  [{atom,Anno,key},{atom,Anno,value}]}]}]}],
  998: 
  999:     TupleCallsFalse = [{attribute,Anno,module,tuple_calls_false}|Forms],
 1000:     {ok,_,TupleCallsFalseBinary} = compile:forms(TupleCallsFalse, [binary]),
 1001:     code:load_binary(tuple_calls_false, "compile_SUITE.erl", TupleCallsFalseBinary),
 1002:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch tuple_calls_false:store(dict())),
 1003:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch tuple_calls_false:size(dict())),
 1004:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch tuple_calls_false:size(empty_tuple())),
 1005: 
 1006:     TupleCallsTrue = [{attribute,Anno,module,tuple_calls_true}|Forms],
 1007:     {ok,_,TupleCallsTrueBinary} = compile:forms(TupleCallsTrue, [binary,tuple_calls]),
 1008:     code:load_binary(tuple_calls_true, "compile_SUITE.erl", TupleCallsTrueBinary),
 1009:     Dict = tuple_calls_true:store(dict()),
 1010:     1 = tuple_calls_true:size(Dict),
 1011:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch tuple_calls_true:size(empty_tuple())),
 1012: 
 1013:     ok.
 1014: 
 1015: dict() ->
 1016:     dict:new().
 1017: empty_tuple() ->
 1018:     {}.
 1019: 
 1020: env(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1021:     {Simple,Target} = get_files(Config, simple, env),
 1022:     {ok,Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1023:     ok = file:set_cwd(filename:dirname(Target)),
 1024: 
 1025:     true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "binary"),
 1026:     try
 1027: 	env_1(Simple, Target)
 1028:     after
 1029: 	true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "ignore_me"),
 1030: 	file:set_cwd(Cwd),
 1031: 	file:delete(Target),
 1032: 	file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target))
 1033:     end,
 1034:     ok.
 1035: 
 1036: env_1(Simple, Target) ->
 1037:     %% file
 1038:     {ok,simple,<<_/binary>>} = compile:file(Simple),
 1039:     {ok,simple} = compile:noenv_file(Simple, [debug_info]),
 1040:     {ok,simple} = compile:noenv_file(Simple, debug_info),
 1041: 
 1042:     true = exists(Target),
 1043:     {ok,{simple,[{abstract_code,Abstr0}]}} =
 1044: 	beam_lib:chunks(Target, [abstract_code]),
 1045:     {raw_abstract_v1,Forms} = Abstr0,
 1046: 
 1047:     %% forms
 1048:     true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "strong_validation"),
 1049:     {ok,simple} = compile:forms(Forms),
 1050:     {ok,simple,<<"FOR1",_/binary>>} = compile:noenv_forms(Forms, []),
 1051: 
 1052:     %% output_generated
 1053:     false = compile:output_generated([]),
 1054:     true = compile:noenv_output_generated([]),
 1055: 
 1056:     ok = file:delete(Target),
 1057: 
 1058:     %% Cover error handling.
 1059:     true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "'unterminated_atom"),
 1060:     {ok,[]} = compile:forms(Forms, [basic_validation]),
 1061:     true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", ",,,"),
 1062:     {ok,[]} = compile:forms(Forms, [basic_validation]),
 1063:     {ok,simple,<<"FOR1",_/binary>>} = compile:noenv_forms(Forms, no_postopt),
 1064: 
 1065:     ok.
 1066: 
 1067: %% Test pretty-printing in Core Erlang format and then try to
 1068: %% compile the generated Core Erlang files.
 1069: 
 1070: core_pp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1071:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1072:     Outdir = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME)),
 1073:     ok = file:make_dir(Outdir),
 1074: 
 1075:     TestBeams = get_unique_beam_files(),
 1076:     Abstr = [begin {ok,{Mod,[{abstract_code,
 1077: 				    {raw_abstract_v1,Abstr}}]}} = 
 1078: 			     beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
 1079: 			 {Mod,Abstr} end || Beam <- TestBeams],
 1080:     test_lib:p_run(fun(F) -> do_core_pp(F, Outdir) end, Abstr).
 1081:     
 1082: do_core_pp({M,A}, Outdir) ->
 1083:     try
 1084: 	do_core_pp_1(M, A, Outdir)
 1085:     catch
 1086: 	throw:{error,Error} ->
 1087: 	    io:format("*** compilation failure '~p' for module ~s\n",
 1088: 		      [Error,M]),
 1089: 	    error;
 1090: 	Class:Error:Stk ->
 1091: 	    io:format("~p: ~p ~p\n~p\n", [M,Class,Error,Stk]),
 1092: 	    error
 1093:     end.
 1094: 
 1095: do_core_pp_1(M, A, Outdir) ->
 1096:     {ok,M,Core0} = compile:forms(A, [to_core]),
 1097:     CoreFile = filename:join(Outdir, atom_to_list(M)++".core"),
 1098:     CorePP = core_pp:format(Core0),
 1099:     ok = file:write_file(CoreFile, unicode:characters_to_binary(CorePP)),
 1100: 
 1101:     %% Parse the .core file and return the result as Core Erlang Terms.
 1102:     Core = case compile:file(CoreFile, [report_errors,from_core,no_copt,to_core,binary]) of
 1103: 	       {ok,M,Core1} -> Core1;
 1104: 	       Other -> throw({error,Other})
 1105: 	   end,
 1106:     ok = file:delete(CoreFile),
 1107: 
 1108:     %% Compile as usual (including optimizations).
 1109:     compile_forms(M, Core, [clint,ssalint,from_core,binary]),
 1110: 
 1111:     %% Don't optimize to test that we are not dependent
 1112:     %% on the Core Erlang optimization passes.
 1113:     %% (Example of a previous bug: The core_parse pass
 1114:     %% would not turn map literals into #c_literal{}
 1115:     %% records; if sys_core_fold was run it would fix
 1116:     %% that; if sys_core_fold was not run v3_kernel would
 1117:     %% crash.)
 1118:     compile_forms(M, Core, [clint,ssalint,from_core,no_copt,binary]),
 1119: 
 1120:     ok.
 1121: 
 1122: compile_forms(Mod, Forms, Opts) ->
 1123:     case compile:forms(Forms, [report_errors|Opts]) of
 1124: 	{ok,Mod,_} ->  ok;
 1125: 	Other -> throw({error,Other})
 1126:     end.
 1127: 
 1128: %% Pretty-print core and read it back. Should be identical.
 1129: 
 1130: core_roundtrip(Config) ->
 1131:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1132:     Outdir = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME)),
 1133:     ok = file:make_dir(Outdir),
 1134: 
 1135:     TestBeams = get_unique_beam_files(),
 1136: 
 1137:     Test = fun(F) -> do_core_roundtrip(F, Outdir) end,
 1138:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
 1139:         4 ->
 1140:             %% This test case is very memory intensive. Only
 1141:             %% use a single process.
 1142:             test_lib:p_run(Test, TestBeams, 1);
 1143:         8 ->
 1144:             test_lib:p_run(Test, TestBeams)
 1145:     end.
 1146: 
 1147: do_core_roundtrip(Beam, Outdir) ->
 1148:     try
 1149: 	{ok,{Mod,[{abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,Abstr}}]}} =
 1150: 	    beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
 1151: 	do_core_roundtrip_1(Mod, Abstr, Outdir)
 1152:     catch
 1153: 	throw:{error,Error} ->
 1154: 	    io:format("*** compilation failure '~p' for file ~s\n",
 1155: 		      [Error,Beam]),
 1156: 	    error;
 1157: 	Class:Error:Stk ->
 1158: 	    io:format("~p: ~p ~p\n~p\n", [Beam,Class,Error,Stk]),
 1159: 	    error
 1160:     end.
 1161: 
 1162: do_core_roundtrip_1(Mod, Abstr, Outdir) ->
 1163:     {ok,Mod,Core0} = compile:forms(Abstr, [to_core0]),
 1164:     do_core_roundtrip_2(Mod, Core0, Outdir),
 1165: 
 1166:     %% Primarily, test that annotations are accepted for all
 1167:     %% constructs. Secondarily, smoke test cerl_trees:label/1.
 1168:     {Core1,_} = cerl_trees:label(Core0),
 1169:     do_core_roundtrip_2(Mod, Core1, Outdir),
 1170: 
 1171:     %% Run the inliner to force generation of variables
 1172:     %% with numeric names.
 1173:     {ok,Mod,Core2} = compile:forms(Abstr, [inline,to_core]),
 1174:     do_core_roundtrip_2(Mod, Core2, Outdir).
 1175: 
 1176: do_core_roundtrip_2(M, Core0, Outdir) ->
 1177:     CoreFile = filename:join(Outdir, atom_to_list(M)++".core"),
 1178:     CorePP = core_pp:format_all(Core0),
 1179:     ok = file:write_file(CoreFile, unicode:characters_to_binary(CorePP)),
 1180: 
 1181:     %% Parse the .core file and return the result as Core Erlang Terms.
 1182:     Core2 = case compile:file(CoreFile, [report_errors,from_core,
 1183: 					 no_copt,to_core,binary]) of
 1184: 		{ok,M,Core1} -> Core1;
 1185: 		Other -> throw({error,Other})
 1186: 	    end,
 1187:     Core = undo_var_translation(Core2),
 1188:     ok = file:delete(CoreFile),
 1189: 
 1190:     case cmp_core(Core0, Core, M) of
 1191: 	true -> ok;
 1192: 	false -> error
 1193:     end.
 1194: 
 1195: undo_var_translation(Tree) ->
 1196:     F = fun(Node) ->
 1197: 		case cerl:is_c_var(Node) of
 1198: 		    true ->
 1199: 			Name0 = cerl:var_name(Node),
 1200: 			try atom_to_list(Name0) of
 1201: 			    "_X"++Name ->
 1202: 				cerl:update_c_var(Node, list_to_atom(Name));
 1203: 			    "_"++Name ->
 1204: 				cerl:update_c_var(Node, list_to_atom(Name));
 1205: 			    _ ->
 1206: 				Node
 1207: 			catch
 1208: 			    error:badarg ->
 1209: 				Node
 1210: 
 1211: 			end;
 1212: 		    false ->
 1213: 			Node
 1214: 		end
 1215: 	end,
 1216:     cerl_trees:map(F, Tree).
 1217: 
 1218: cmp_core(E, E, _Mod) ->
 1219:     true;
 1220: cmp_core(M1, M2, Mod) ->
 1221:     cmp_core_fs(cerl:module_defs(M1), cerl:module_defs(M2), Mod).
 1222: 
 1223: cmp_core_fs([F1|T1], [F2|T2], Mod) ->
 1224:     cmp_core_f(F1, F2, Mod) andalso cmp_core_fs(T1, T2, Mod);
 1225: cmp_core_fs([], [], _Mod) ->
 1226:     true;
 1227: cmp_core_fs(_, _, _Mod) ->
 1228:     false.
 1229: 
 1230: cmp_core_f(E, E, _Mod) ->
 1231:     true;
 1232: cmp_core_f({Name,F1}, {Name,F2}, Mod) ->
 1233:     case diff(F1, F2) of
 1234: 	F1 ->
 1235: 	    true;
 1236: 	Diff ->
 1237: 	    io:format("~p ~p:\n~p\n", [Mod,Name,Diff]),
 1238: 	    false
 1239:     end.
 1240: 
 1241: diff(E, E) ->
 1242:     E;
 1243: diff([H1|T1], [H2|T2]) ->
 1244:     [diff(H1, H2)|diff(T1, T2)];
 1245: diff(T1, T2) when tuple_size(T1) =:= tuple_size(T2) ->
 1246:     case cerl:is_c_var(T1) andalso cerl:is_c_var(T2) of
 1247:         true ->
 1248:             diff_var(T1, T2);
 1249:         false ->
 1250:             case cerl:is_c_map(T1) andalso cerl:is_c_map(T2) of
 1251:                 true ->
 1252:                     diff_map(T1, T2);
 1253:                 false ->
 1254:                     diff_tuple(T1, T2)
 1255:             end
 1256:     end;
 1257: diff(E1, E2) ->
 1258:     {'DIFF',E1,E2}.
 1259: 
 1260: diff_var(V1, V2) ->
 1261:     case {cerl:var_name(V1),cerl:var_name(V2)} of
 1262:         {Same,Same} ->
 1263:             V1;
 1264:         {Name1,Name2} ->
 1265:             %% The inliner uses integers as variable names. Such integers
 1266:             %% are read back as atoms.
 1267:             case is_integer(Name1) andalso
 1268:                 list_to_atom(integer_to_list(Name1)) =:= Name2 of
 1269:                 true ->
 1270:                     V1;
 1271:                 _ ->
 1272:                     cerl:update_c_var(V1, {'DIFF',Name1,Name2})
 1273:             end
 1274:     end.
 1275: 
 1276: %% Annotations for maps are not preserved exactly, but that is not
 1277: %% a real problem. Workaround by not comparing all annotations when
 1278: %% comparing maps.
 1279: 
 1280: diff_map(M, M) ->
 1281:     M;
 1282: diff_map(M1, M2) ->
 1283:     case cerl:get_ann(M1) =:= cerl:get_ann(M2) of
 1284:         false ->
 1285:             diff_tuple(M1, M2);
 1286:         true ->
 1287:             case remove_compiler_gen(M1) =:= remove_compiler_gen(M2) of
 1288:                 true ->
 1289:                     M1;
 1290:                 false ->
 1291:                     diff_tuple(M1, M2)
 1292:             end
 1293:     end.
 1294: 
 1295: diff_tuple(T1, T2) ->
 1296:     L = diff(tuple_to_list(T1), tuple_to_list(T2)),
 1297:     list_to_tuple(L).
 1298: 
 1299: remove_compiler_gen(M) ->
 1300:     Arg0 = cerl:map_arg(M),
 1301:     Arg = cerl:set_ann(Arg0, []),
 1302:     Es0 = cerl:map_es(M),
 1303:     Es = [remove_compiler_gen_1(Pair) || Pair <- Es0],
 1304:     cerl:update_c_map(M, Arg, Es).
 1305: 
 1306: remove_compiler_gen_1(Pair) ->
 1307:     Op0 = cerl:map_pair_op(Pair),
 1308:     Op = cerl:set_ann(Op0, []),
 1309:     K = map_var(cerl:map_pair_key(Pair)),
 1310:     V = map_var(cerl:map_pair_val(Pair)),
 1311:     cerl:update_c_map_pair(Pair, Op, K, V).
 1312: 
 1313: map_var(Var) ->
 1314:     case cerl:is_c_var(Var) of
 1315:         true ->
 1316:             case cerl:var_name(Var) of
 1317:                 Name when is_atom(Name) ->
 1318:                     L = atom_to_list(Name),
 1319:                     try list_to_integer(L) of
 1320:                         Int ->
 1321:                             cerl:update_c_var(Var, Int)
 1322:                     catch
 1323:                         error:_ ->
 1324:                             Var
 1325:                     end;
 1326:                 _ ->
 1327:                     Var
 1328:             end;
 1329:         false ->
 1330:             Var
 1331:     end.
 1332: 
 1333: %% Compile to Beam assembly language (.S) and then try to
 1334: %% run .S through the compiler again.
 1335: 
 1336: asm(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1337:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1338:     Outdir = filename:join(PrivDir, "asm"),
 1339:     ok = file:make_dir(Outdir),
 1340: 
 1341:     TestBeams = get_unique_beam_files(),
 1342:     Res = test_lib:p_run(fun(F) -> do_asm(F, Outdir) end, TestBeams),
 1343:     Res.
 1344: 
 1345:     
 1346: do_asm(Beam, Outdir) ->
 1347:     {ok,{M,[{abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,A}}]}} =
 1348: 	beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
 1349:     try
 1350:         Opts = test_lib:opt_opts(M),
 1351: 	{ok,M,Asm} = compile:forms(A, ['S'|Opts]),
 1352: 	AsmFile = filename:join(Outdir, atom_to_list(M)++".S"),
 1353: 	{ok,Fd} = file:open(AsmFile, [write,{encoding,utf8}]),
 1354: 	beam_listing:module(Fd, Asm),
 1355: 	ok = file:close(Fd),
 1356:         case compile:file(AsmFile, [from_asm,binary,report|Opts]) of
 1357: 	    {ok,M,_} ->
 1358: 		ok = file:delete(AsmFile);
 1359: 	    Other ->
 1360: 		io:format("*** failure '~p' for ~s\n",
 1361: 			  [Other,AsmFile]),
 1362: 		error
 1363: 	end
 1364:     catch Class:Error:Stk ->
 1365: 	    io:format("~p: ~p ~p\n~p\n", [M,Class,Error,Stk]),
 1366: 	    error
 1367:     end.
 1368: 
 1369: %% Compile a crafted file which produces the three call instructions
 1370: %% which should have a comment with the called function in clear
 1371: %% text. We check that the expected functions and comments occur in
 1372: %% the listing.
 1373: 
 1374: asm_labels(Config) ->
 1375:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1376:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1377:     InFile = filename:join(DataDir, "asm_labels.erl"),
 1378:     OutDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "asm_labels"),
 1379:     OutFile = filename:join(OutDir, "asm_labels.S"),
 1380:     ok = file:make_dir(OutDir),
 1381:     {ok,asm_labels} = compile:file(InFile, ['S',{outdir,OutDir}]),
 1382:     {ok,Listing} = file:read_file(OutFile),
 1383:     Os = [global,multiline,{capture,all_but_first,list}],
 1384:     {match,[_]} = re:run(Listing, "({call,.+,{f,.+}}\\. % foo/1)", Os),
 1385:     {match,[_]} = re:run(Listing, "({call_only,.+,{f,.+}}\\. % foo/1)", Os),
 1386:     {match,[_]} = re:run(Listing, "({call_last,.+,{f,.+},.+}\\. % bar/1)", Os),
 1387:     ok = file:del_dir_r(OutDir).
 1388: 
 1389: sys_pre_attributes(Config) ->
 1390:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1391:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "attributes.erl"),
 1392:     Mod = attributes,
 1393:     CommonOpts = [binary,report,verbose,
 1394: 		  {parse_transform,sys_pre_attributes}],
 1395:     PreOpts = [{attribute,delete,deleted}],
 1396:     PostOpts = [{attribute,insert,inserted,"value"}],
 1397:     PrePostOpts = [{attribute,replace,replaced,42},
 1398: 		   {attribute,replace,replace_nonexisting,new}],
 1399:     {ok,Mod,Code} = compile:file(File, PrePostOpts ++ PreOpts ++
 1400: 				     PostOpts ++ CommonOpts),
 1401:     code:load_binary(Mod, File, Code),
 1402:     Attr = Mod:module_info(attributes),
 1403:     io:format("~p", [Attr]),
 1404:     {inserted,"value"} = lists:keyfind(inserted, 1, Attr),
 1405:     {replaced,[42]} = lists:keyfind(replaced, 1, Attr),
 1406:     {replace_nonexisting,[new]} = lists:keyfind(replace_nonexisting, 1, Attr),
 1407:     false = lists:keymember(deleted, 1, Attr),
 1408: 
 1409:     %% Cover more code.
 1410:     {ok,Mod,_} = compile:file(File, PostOpts ++ CommonOpts),
 1411:     {ok,Mod,_} = compile:file(File, CommonOpts -- [verbose]),
 1412:     {ok,Mod,_} = compile:file(File, PreOpts ++ CommonOpts),
 1413:     {ok,Mod,_} = compile:file(File,
 1414: 			      [{attribute,replace,replaced,42}|CommonOpts]),
 1415:     {ok,Mod,_} = compile:file(File, PrePostOpts ++ PreOpts ++
 1416: 				  PostOpts ++ CommonOpts --
 1417: 				  [report,verbose]),
 1418:     ok.
 1419: 
 1420: %% Test the dialyzer option to cover more code.
 1421: dialyzer(Config) ->
 1422:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1423:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config)),
 1424:     Opts = [{outdir,Priv},report_errors],
 1425:     M = dialyzer_test,
 1426:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [dialyzer|Opts]),
 1427:     [{a,b,c}] = M:M(),
 1428: 
 1429:     %% Cover huge line numbers without the 'dialyzer' option.
 1430:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, Opts),
 1431:     [{a,b,c}] = M:M(),
 1432:     ok.
 1433: 
 1434: beam_ssa_pp_smoke_test(Config) ->
 1435:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1436:     Outdir = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME)),
 1437:     ok = file:make_dir(Outdir),
 1438:     TestBeams = get_unique_beam_files(),
 1439:     test_lib:p_run(fun(F) -> beam_ssa_pp(F, Outdir) end, TestBeams).
 1440: 
 1441: beam_ssa_pp(Beam, Outdir) ->
 1442:     try
 1443: 	{ok,{Mod,[{abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,Abstr}}]}} =
 1444: 	    beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
 1445: 	beam_ssa_pp_1(Mod, Abstr, Outdir)
 1446:     catch
 1447: 	throw:{error,Error} ->
 1448: 	    io:format("*** compilation failure '~p' for file ~s\n",
 1449: 		      [Error,Beam]),
 1450: 	    error;
 1451: 	Class:Error:Stk ->
 1452: 	    io:format("~p: ~p ~p\n~p\n", [Beam,Class,Error,Stk]),
 1453: 	    error
 1454:     end.
 1455: 
 1456: beam_ssa_pp_1(Mod, Abstr, Outdir) ->
 1457:     Opts = test_lib:opt_opts(Mod),
 1458:     {ok,Mod,SSA} = compile:forms(Abstr, [dssaopt|Opts]),
 1459:     ListFile = filename:join(Outdir, atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".ssaopt"),
 1460:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(ListFile, [write,{encoding,utf8}]),
 1461:     beam_listing:module(Fd, SSA),
 1462:     ok = file:close(Fd).
 1463: 
 1464: %% Test that warnings contain filenames and line numbers.
 1465: warnings(_Config) ->
 1466:     Files = get_unique_files(".erl"),
 1467:     test_lib:p_run(fun do_warnings/1, Files).
 1468: 
 1469: do_warnings(F) ->
 1470:     Options = [{feature,maybe_expr,enable},binary,bin_opt_info,recv_opt_info,return],
 1471:     {ok,_,_,Ws} = compile:file(F, Options),
 1472:     do_warnings_1(Ws, F).
 1473: 
 1474: do_warnings_1([{"no_file",Ws}|_], F) ->
 1475:     io:format("~s:\nMissing file for warnings: ~p\n",
 1476: 	      [F,Ws]),
 1477:     error;
 1478: do_warnings_1([{Name,Ws}|T], F) ->
 1479:     case filename:extension(Name) of
 1480: 	".erl" ->
 1481: 	    do_warnings_2(Ws, T, F);
 1482: 	_ ->
 1483: 	    io:format("~s:\nNo .erl extension\n", [F]),
 1484: 	    error
 1485:     end;
 1486: do_warnings_1([], _) -> ok.
 1487: 
 1488: do_warnings_2([{Pos,_,_}=W|T], Next, F) ->
 1489:     case Pos of
 1490: 	Line when is_integer(Line) ->
 1491: 	    do_warnings_2(T, Next, F);
 1492: 	{Line,Col} when is_integer(Line), is_integer(Col) ->
 1493: 	    do_warnings_2(T, Next, F);
 1494: 	true ->
 1495: 	    io:format("~s:\nMissing line number: ~p\n",
 1496: 		      [F,W]),
 1497: 	    error
 1498:     end;
 1499: do_warnings_2([], Next, F) ->
 1500:     do_warnings_1(Next, F).
 1501: 
 1502: message_printing(Config) ->
 1503:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1504:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1505: 
 1506:     BadEncFile = filename:join(DataDir, "bad_enc.erl"),
 1507:     {error,BadEncErrors, []} = compile:file(BadEncFile, [return]),
 1508: 
 1509:     [":7:15: cannot parse file, giving up\n"
 1510:      "%    7| \t    {ok, \"xyz\n"
 1511:      "%     | \t             ^\n\n"
 1512:     ,
 1513:      ":7:15: cannot translate from UTF-8\n"
 1514:      "%    7| \t    {ok, \"xyz\n"
 1515:      "%     | \t             ^\n\n"
 1516:     ] = messages(BadEncErrors),
 1517: 
 1518:     UTF8File = filename:join(DataDir, "col_utf8.erl"),
 1519:     {ok,_,UTF8Errors} = compile:file(UTF8File, [return]),
 1520:     [":5:23: a term is constructed, but never used\n"
 1521:      "%    5|     B = <<\"xyzåäö\">>,\t<<\"12345\">>,\n"
 1522:      "%     |                      \t^\n\n"
 1523:     ] = messages(UTF8Errors),
 1524: 
 1525:     Latin1File = filename:join(DataDir, "col_lat1.erl"),
 1526:     {ok,_,Latin1Errors} = compile:file(Latin1File, [return]),
 1527:     [":6:23: a term is constructed, but never used\n"
 1528:      "%    6|     B = <<\"xyzåäö\">>,\t<<\"12345\">>,\n"
 1529:      "%     |                      \t^\n\n"
 1530:     ] = messages(Latin1Errors),
 1531: 
 1532:     LongFile = filename:join(PrivDir, "long.erl"),
 1533:     Long = ["-module(long).\n",
 1534:             "-export([foo/0]).\n",
 1535:             "unused() -> ok.\n",
 1536:             lists:duplicate(10000, $\n),
 1537:             "foo() -> bar().\n"],
 1538:     ok = file:write_file(LongFile, Long),
 1539:     {error,LongErrors,LongWarnings} = compile:file(LongFile, [return]),
 1540:     [":10004:10: function bar/0 undefined\n"
 1541:      "% 10004| foo() -> bar().\n"
 1542:      "%      |          ^\n\n"
 1543:     ] = messages(LongErrors),
 1544:     [":3:1: function unused/0 is unused\n"
 1545:      "%    3| unused() -> ok.\n"
 1546:      "%     | ^\n\n"
 1547:     ] = messages(LongWarnings),
 1548:     ok = file:delete(LongFile),
 1549: 
 1550:     {ok,OldCwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1551:     try
 1552:         ok = file:set_cwd(DataDir),
 1553:         {ok,cover_messages,_} = compile:file(cover_messages, [report, binary])
 1554:     after
 1555:         file:set_cwd(OldCwd)
 1556:     end,
 1557: 
 1558:     ok.
 1559: 
 1560: messages(Errors) ->
 1561:     lists:flatmap(fun ({{File,_L},Descs}) -> format_descs(File, Descs);
 1562:                       ({File,Descs}) -> format_descs(File, Descs)
 1563:                   end,
 1564:                   Errors).
 1565: 
 1566: format_descs(File, Descs) ->
 1567:     [strip_prefix(File, lists:flatten(Text))
 1568:      || {_Where, Text} <- sys_messages:format_messages(File, "", Descs, [])].
 1569: 
 1570: strip_prefix(Prefix, String) ->
 1571:     case string:prefix(String, Prefix) of
 1572:         nomatch -> String;
 1573:         Rest -> Rest
 1574:     end.
 1575: 
 1576: %% Test that the compile:pre_load/0 function (used by 'erlc')
 1577: %% pre-loads the modules that are used by a typical compilation.
 1578: 
 1579: pre_load_check(Config) ->
 1580:     case test_server:is_cover() of
 1581:         true ->
 1582:             {skip,"Cover is running"};
 1583:         false ->
 1584:             try
 1585:                 do_pre_load_check(Config)
 1586:             after
 1587:                 dbg:stop()
 1588:             end
 1589:     end.
 1590: 
 1591: do_pre_load_check(Config) ->
 1592:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir, Config),
 1593:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, "simple.erl"),
 1594:     Big = filename:join(DataDir, "big.erl"),
 1595:     {ok,_} = dbg:tracer(process, {fun pre_load_trace/2,[]}),
 1596:     dbg:p(self(), call),
 1597:     dbg:p(new, call),
 1598:     {ok,_} = dbg:tpl({?MODULE,get_trace_data,0}, []),
 1599:     {ok,_} = dbg:tp({code,ensure_modules_loaded,1}, []),
 1600: 
 1601:     %% Compile a simple module using the erl_compile interface
 1602:     %% to find out the modules that are pre-loaded by
 1603:     %% compile:pre_load/0.
 1604:     Opts = #options{specific=[binary]},
 1605:     {ok,simple,_} = compile:compile(Simple, "", Opts),
 1606:     [{code,ensure_modules_loaded,[PreLoaded0]}] = get_trace_data(),
 1607:     PreLoaded1 = ordsets:from_list(PreLoaded0),
 1608: 
 1609:     %% Since 'compile' is the function doing the pre-loaded,
 1610:     %% it is useless to include it in the list.
 1611:     case ordsets:is_element(compile, PreLoaded1) of
 1612: 	true ->
 1613: 	    io:put_chars("The 'compile' module should not be included "
 1614: 			 "in the list of modules to be pre-loaded."),
 1615: 	    ct:fail(compile);
 1616: 	false ->
 1617: 	    []
 1618:     end,
 1619:     PreLoaded = ordsets:add_element(compile, PreLoaded1),
 1620: 
 1621:     %% Now unload all pre-loaded modules and all modules in
 1622:     %% compiler application. Then compile a module to find
 1623:     %% which modules that get loaded.
 1624:     CompilerMods = compiler_modules(),
 1625:     Unload = ordsets:union(ordsets:from_list(CompilerMods), PreLoaded),
 1626:     _ = [begin
 1627: 	     code:delete(M),
 1628: 	     code:purge(M)
 1629: 	 end || M <- Unload],
 1630: 
 1631:     {ok,_} = dbg:ctp({code,ensure_modules_loaded,1}),
 1632:     {ok,_} = dbg:tp({code,ensure_loaded,1}, []),
 1633:     {ok,big,_} = compile:file(Big, [binary]),
 1634:     WasLoaded0 = get_trace_data(),
 1635:     WasLoaded1 = [M || {code,ensure_loaded,[M]} <- WasLoaded0],
 1636:     WasLoaded = ordsets:from_list(WasLoaded1),
 1637: 
 1638:     %% Check for modules that should have been pre-loaded.
 1639:     case ordsets:subtract(WasLoaded, PreLoaded) of
 1640: 	[] ->
 1641: 	    ok;
 1642: 	[_|_]=NotPreLoaded ->
 1643: 	    io:format("The following modules were used "
 1644: 		      "but not pre-loaded:\n~p\n",
 1645: 		      [NotPreLoaded]),
 1646: 	    ct:fail({not_preload,NotPreLoaded})
 1647:     end,
 1648: 
 1649:     %% Check for modules that should not be pre-loaded.
 1650:     case ordsets:subtract(PreLoaded, WasLoaded) of
 1651: 	[] ->
 1652: 	    ok;
 1653: 	[_|_]=NotUsed ->
 1654: 	    io:format("The following modules were pre-loaded"
 1655: 		      " but not used:\n~p\n",
 1656: 		      [NotUsed]),
 1657: 	    ct:fail({not_used,NotUsed})
 1658:     end,
 1659: 
 1660:     ok.
 1661: 
 1662: get_trace_data() ->
 1663:     %% Apparantely, doing a receive at the beginning of
 1664:     %% a traced function can cause extra trace messages.
 1665:     %% To avoid that, don't do the receive in this function.
 1666:     do_get_trace_data().
 1667: 
 1668: do_get_trace_data() ->
 1669:     receive
 1670: 	{trace_data,Data} -> Data
 1671:     end.
 1672: 
 1673: pre_load_trace({trace,Pid,call,{?MODULE,get_trace_data,[]}}, Acc) ->
 1674:     Pid ! {trace_data,Acc},
 1675:     [];
 1676: pre_load_trace({trace,_,call,MFA}, Acc) ->
 1677:     [MFA|Acc].
 1678: 
 1679: compiler_modules() ->
 1680:     Wc = filename:join([code:lib_dir(compiler),"ebin","*.beam"]),
 1681:     Ms = filelib:wildcard(Wc),
 1682:     FN = filename,
 1683:     [list_to_atom(FN:rootname(FN:basename(M), ".beam")) || M <- Ms].
 1684: 
 1685: %% Test that ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS are correctly retrieved
 1686: %% by env_compiler_options/0
 1687: 
 1688: env_compiler_options(_Config) ->
 1689:     Cases = [
 1690:         {"bin_opt_info", [bin_opt_info]},
 1691:         {"recv_opt_info", [recv_opt_info]},
 1692:         {"'S'", ['S']},
 1693:         {"{source, \"test.erl\"}", [{source, "test.erl"}]},
 1694:         {"[{d,macro_one,1},{d,macro_two}]", [{d, macro_one, 1}, {d, macro_two}]},
 1695:         {"[warn_export_all, warn_export_vars]", [warn_export_all, warn_export_vars]}
 1696:     ],
 1697:     F = fun({Env, Expected}) ->
 1698:         true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", Env),
 1699:         Expected = compile:env_compiler_options()
 1700:     end,
 1701:     lists:foreach(F, Cases).
 1702: 
 1703: %% Test options for compatibility with previous major versions of OTP.
 1704: 
 1705: bc_options(Config) ->
 1706:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1707: 
 1708:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1709: 
 1710:     L = [{171, small_float, [no_line_info,
 1711:                              no_ssa_opt_float,
 1712:                              no_type_opt]},
 1713:          {171, small_float, [no_line_info]},
 1714:          {171, small_float, []},
 1715:          {171, small_float, [r24]},
 1716:          {171, small_float, [r25]},
 1717: 
 1718:          {172, small, [no_ssa_opt_record,
 1719:                        no_ssa_opt_float,
 1720:                        no_line_info,
 1721:                        no_type_opt,
 1722:                        no_bs_match]},
 1723:          {172, small, [r24]},
 1724: 
 1725:          {172, funs, [no_ssa_opt_record,
 1726:                       no_ssa_opt_float,no_line_info,
 1727:                       no_type_opt]},
 1728:          {172, funs, [no_ssa_opt_record,
 1729:                       no_line_info,
 1730:                       no_stack_trimming,
 1731:                       no_type_opt]},
 1732:          {172, funs, [r24]},
 1733: 
 1734:          {172, small_maps, [r24]},
 1735:          {172, small_maps, [no_type_opt]},
 1736: 
 1737:          {172, big, [no_ssa_opt_record,
 1738:                      no_ssa_opt_float,
 1739:                      no_line_info,
 1740:                      no_type_opt]},
 1741:          {172, big, [r24]},
 1742: 
 1743:          {178, small, [r25]},
 1744:          {178, big, [r25]},
 1745:          {178, funs, []},
 1746:          {178, big, []}
 1747:         ],
 1748: 
 1749:     Test = fun({Expected,Mod,Options}) ->
 1750:                    case highest_opcode(DataDir, Mod, Options) of
 1751:                        Expected ->
 1752:                            ok;
 1753:                        Got ->
 1754:                            io:format("*** module ~p, options ~p => got ~p; expected ~p\n",
 1755:                                      [Mod,Options,Got,Expected]),
 1756:                            error
 1757:                    end
 1758:            end,
 1759:     test_lib:p_run(Test, L),
 1760:     ok.
 1761: 
 1762: highest_opcode(DataDir, Mod, Opt) ->
 1763:     Src = filename:join(DataDir, atom_to_list(Mod)++".erl"),
 1764:     {ok,Mod,Beam} = compile:file(Src, [binary,report_errors|Opt]),
 1765:     test_lib:highest_opcode(Beam).
 1766: 
 1767: deterministic_include(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1768:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1769:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, "simple"),
 1770:  
 1771:     %% Files without +deterministic should differ if their include paths do,
 1772:     %% as their debug info will be different.
 1773:     {ok,_,NonDetA} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, {i,"gurka"}]),
 1774:     {ok,_,NonDetB} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, {i,"gaffel"}]),
 1775:     true = NonDetA =/= NonDetB,
 1776: 
 1777:     %% ... but files with +deterministic shouldn't.
 1778:     {ok,_,DetC} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, deterministic, {i,"gurka"}]),
 1779:     {ok,_,DetD} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, deterministic, {i,"gaffel"}]),
 1780:     true = DetC =:= DetD,
 1781: 
 1782:     ok.
 1783: 
 1784: deterministic_paths(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1785:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1786: 
 1787:     %% Files without +deterministic should differ if they were compiled from a
 1788:     %% different directory.
 1789:     true = deterministic_paths_1(DataDir, "simple", []),
 1790: 
 1791:     %% ... but files with +deterministic shouldn't.
 1792:     false = deterministic_paths_1(DataDir, "simple", [deterministic]),
 1793: 
 1794:     ok.
 1795: 
 1796: deterministic_paths_1(DataDir, Name, Opts) ->
 1797:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, "simple"),
 1798:     {ok, Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1799:     try
 1800:         {ok,_,A} = compile:file(Simple, [binary | Opts]),
 1801:         ok = file:set_cwd(DataDir),
 1802:         {ok,_,B} = compile:file(Name, [binary | Opts]),
 1803:         A =/= B
 1804:     after
 1805:         file:set_cwd(Cwd)
 1806:     end.
 1807: 
 1808: %% The test case uses ssh.erl from ssh application.
 1809: deterministic_docs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1810:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1811:     Filepath = filename:join(DataDir, "ssh"),
 1812:     false = deterministic_docs_1(Filepath, [binary], 25),
 1813:     true = deterministic_docs_1(Filepath, [binary, deterministic], 25),
 1814:     ok.
 1815: 
 1816: deterministic_docs_1(Filepath, Opts, Checks) ->
 1817:     {ok, _, Reference} = compile:file(Filepath, Opts),
 1818:     lists:all(
 1819:       fun(_) ->
 1820:               {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{}),
 1821:               {ok, _, Testing} =
 1822:                   erpc:call(
 1823:                     Node,
 1824:                     fun() ->
 1825:                             compile:file(Filepath, Opts)
 1826:                     end),
 1827:               peer:stop(Peer),
 1828:               Testing =:= Reference
 1829:       end, lists:seq(1, Checks)).
 1830: 
 1831: %% ERL-1058: -compile(debug_info) had no effect
 1832: compile_attribute(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1833:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1834: 
 1835:     %% The test module has a -compile([debug_info]). attribute, which means
 1836:     %% debug information should always be included.
 1837:     debug_info_attribute(DataDir, "debug_info", [debug_info]),
 1838:     debug_info_attribute(DataDir, "debug_info", []),
 1839: 
 1840:     ok.
 1841: 
 1842: debug_info_attribute(DataDir, Name, Opts) ->
 1843:     File = filename:join(DataDir, Name),
 1844:     {ok,_,Bin} = compile:file(File, [binary | Opts]),
 1845:     {ok, {_, Attrs}} = beam_lib:chunks(Bin, [debug_info]),
 1846: 
 1847:     [{debug_info,{debug_info_v1,erl_abstract_code, {Forms, _}}}] = Attrs,
 1848:     [{attribute,{1,1},file,{_,1}},
 1849:      {attribute,{1,2},module,debug_info},
 1850:      {attribute,{2,2},compile,[debug_info]},
 1851:      {eof,_}] = forms_to_terms(Forms),
 1852: 
 1853:     ok.
 1854: 
 1855: forms_to_terms(Forms) ->
 1856:     [erl_parse:anno_to_term(Form) || Form <- Forms].
 1857: 
 1858: %% Test compiler options not tested in other test cases.
 1859: other_options(Config) ->
 1860:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1861: 
 1862:     %% Smoke test of no_spawn_compiler_process, brief, and absolute_source
 1863:     %% options.
 1864:     Big = filename:join(DataDir, "big"),
 1865:     {ok,big,<<_/binary>>} =
 1866:         compile:file(Big, [binary,
 1867:                            no_spawn_compiler_process,
 1868:                            brief,
 1869:                            absolute_source,
 1870:                            report]),
 1871: 
 1872:     %% Test generating a compressed BEAM file. Also cover the redundant
 1873:     %% `beam` option and the `no_inline` option.
 1874:     Small = filename:join(DataDir, "small"),
 1875:     {ok,small} = compile:file(Small, [report, no_inline, compressed, beam]),
 1876: 
 1877:     ok.
 1878: 
 1879: %% Test core transforms and parse transforms.
 1880: transforms(Config) ->
 1881:     {ok, Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1882:     try
 1883:         do_transforms(Config)
 1884:     after
 1885:         file:set_cwd(Cwd)
 1886:     end.
 1887: 
 1888: do_transforms(Config) ->
 1889:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1890:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1891:     TargetDir = filename:join(PrivDir, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
 1892:     ok = file:make_dir(TargetDir),
 1893:     ok = file:set_cwd(TargetDir),
 1894: 
 1895:     %% Compile our parse transforms.
 1896:     LinePt = filename:join(DataDir, "line_pt"),
 1897:     {ok,line_pt} = compile:file(LinePt, [report, {outdir,TargetDir}]),
 1898:     ColumnPt = filename:join(DataDir, "column_pt"),
 1899:     {ok,column_pt} = compile:file(ColumnPt, [report, {outdir,TargetDir}]),
 1900:     GenericPt = filename:join(DataDir, "generic_pt"),
 1901:     {ok,generic_pt} = compile:file(GenericPt, [report, {outdir,TargetDir}]),
 1902: 
 1903:     %% Compile a file using line_pt and verify that column numbers
 1904:     %% have been stripped.
 1905:     Big = filename:join(DataDir, "big"),
 1906:     {[],[_|_]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{parse_transform,line_pt}]),
 1907: 
 1908:     %% Compile a file using column_pt and verify that column numbers
 1909:     %% have NOT been stripped.
 1910:     {[_|_],[]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{parse_transform,column_pt}]),
 1911: 
 1912:     %% Compile a file using column_pt and error_location=line and verify
 1913:     %% that column numbers have been stripped.
 1914:     {[],[_|_]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{error_location,line},
 1915:                                                   {parse_transform,column_pt}]),
 1916: 
 1917:     %% Compile a file using column_pt, line_pt and verify
 1918:     %% that column numbers have been stripped.
 1919:     {[],[_|_]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{parse_transform,column_pt},
 1920:                                                   {parse_transform,line_pt}]),
 1921: 
 1922:     %% Compile a file using column_pt that adds columns and error_location=line and
 1923:     %% verify that column numbers have been stripped.
 1924:     {[],[_|_]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{error_location,line},
 1925:                                                   add_columns,
 1926:                                                   {parse_transform,column_pt}]),
 1927: 
 1928:     %% Compile a file using column_pt that adds columns and error_location=line and
 1929:     %% then call column_pt again to check that columns are stripped in between calls.
 1930:     %% and then verify that column numbers have been stripped from output.
