 1931:     {[],[_|_]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{error_location,line},
 1932:                                                   add_columns,
 1933:                                                   {parse_transform,column_pt},
 1934:                                                   {parse_transform,column_pt}]),
 1935: 
 1936:     %% Compile a file using column_pt that adds columns and en error and error_location=line and
 1937:     %% verify that column numbers have been stripped.
 1938:     {error,[{_What,[{Line,_,_}]}],[_|_]} =
 1939:         compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{error_location,line},
 1940:                                          add_columns,
 1941:                                          add_error,
 1942:                                          {parse_transform,column_pt}]),
 1943:     true = is_integer(Line),
 1944: 
 1945:     %% Cover transform code implementing the `time` option.
 1946:     {ok,big,_} = compile:file(Big, [binary, time, report,
 1947:                                     {core_transform,generic_pt},
 1948:                                     {parse_transform,generic_pt}]),
 1949: 
 1950:     %% Test exceptions from a core transform.
 1951:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, simple),
 1952:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {core_transform,generic_pt}, {action, crash}]),
 1953:     {error,_,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {core_transform,generic_pt}, {action, crash}]),
 1954: 
 1955:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {core_transform,generic_pt}, {action, throw}]),
 1956:     {error,_,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {core_transform,generic_pt}, {action, throw}]),
 1957: 
 1958:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {core_transform,generic_pt}, {action, exit}]),
 1959:     {error,_,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {core_transform,generic_pt}, {action, exit}]),
 1960: 
 1961:     %% Test exceptions from a parse transform.
 1962:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, crash}]),
 1963:     {error,_,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, crash}]),
 1964: 
 1965:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, throw}]),
 1966:     {error,_,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, throw}]),
 1967: 
 1968:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, exit}]),
 1969:     {error,_,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, exit}]),
 1970: 
 1971:     %% Test generating errors and warnings in a parse_transform.
 1972:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [report, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, warning}]),
 1973:     {ok,simple,[_|_]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, warning}]),
 1974:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, error}]),
 1975:     {error,[_|_],[_|_]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, error}]),
 1976:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, undefined_error}]),
 1977:     {error,[_|_],[]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, undefined_error}]),
 1978: 
 1979:     ok.
 1980: 
 1981: compile_partition_warnings(Source, Opts) ->
 1982:     case compile:file(Source, [binary, return | Opts]) of
 1983:         {ok,big,<<_/binary>>,Ws0} ->
 1984:             [{_SourcePath,Ws}] = Ws0,
 1985: 
 1986:             %% Return {[ColumnWarning], [LineWarning]}.
 1987:             lists:partition(fun({{L,C},_,_}) when is_integer(L), is_integer(C) -> true;
 1988:                                ({L,_,_}) when is_integer(L) -> false
 1989:                             end, Ws);
 1990:         Error ->
 1991:             Error
 1992:     end.
 1993: 
 1994: %% Cover the erl_compile API used by erlc.
 1995: erl_compile_api(Config) ->
 1996:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1997:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1998:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, "simple.erl"),
 1999: 
 2000:     Opts = #options{outdir=PrivDir},
 2001:     BinOpts = Opts#options{specific=[binary]},
 2002: 
 2003:     ok = compile:compile(Simple, "ignored", Opts),
 2004:     ok = compile:compile(Simple, "ignored", Opts#options{cwd=PrivDir,includes=[PrivDir]}),
 2005:     {ok,simple,_} = compile:compile(Simple, "ignored", BinOpts),
 2006: 
 2007:     ok = compile:compile(Simple, "ignored", Opts#options{specific=[dabstr]}),
 2008:     ok = compile:compile(Simple, "ignored", Opts#options{specific=[to_core]}),
 2009:     ok = compile:compile(Simple, "ignored", Opts#options{specific=[to_asm]}),
 2010: 
 2011:     SimpleAbstr = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple.abstr"),
 2012:     SimpleCore = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple.core"),
 2013:     SimpleAsm = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple.S"),
 2014: 
 2015:     ok = compile:compile_abstr(SimpleAbstr, "ignored", Opts),
 2016:     ok = compile:compile_core(SimpleCore, "ignored", Opts),
 2017:     ok = compile:compile_asm(SimpleAsm, "ignored", Opts),
 2018: 
 2019:     {ok,simple,<<_/binary>>} = compile:compile_abstr(SimpleAbstr, "ignored", BinOpts),
 2020:     {ok,simple,<<_/binary>>} = compile:compile_core(SimpleCore, "ignored", BinOpts),
 2021:     {ok,simple,<<_/binary>>} = compile:compile_asm(SimpleAsm, "ignored", BinOpts),
 2022: 
 2023:     NeedsDefines = filename:join(DataDir, "needs_defines.erl"),
 2024:     ok = compile:compile(NeedsDefines, "ignored", Opts#options{defines=[compile_this,{'TEST_RESULT',whatever}]}),
 2025: 
 2026:     ok = file:delete(SimpleAbstr),
 2027:     ok = file:delete(SimpleCore),
 2028:     ok = file:delete(SimpleAsm),
 2029:     ok = file:delete(filename:join(PrivDir, "simple.beam")),
 2030:     ok = file:delete(filename:join(PrivDir, "needs_defines.beam")),
 2031: 
 2032:     ok.
 2033: 
 2034: %% Check that an ssa dump contains the pretty printed types we expect.
 2035: %% The module we compile and dump, types_pp, is crafted so it contains
 2036: %% calls to functions which have the result types we want to check the
 2037: %% pretty printer for. We check all types except for bs_context,
 2038: %% bs_matchable and the interval form of float as the first two never
 2039: %% seem to appear in result types and the latter doesn't appear in any
 2040: %% module compiled by diffable.
 2041: types_pp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2042:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2043:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2044:     TargetDir = filename:join(PrivDir, types_pp),
 2045:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "types_pp.erl"),
 2046:     Listing = filename:join(TargetDir, "types_pp.ssaopt"),
 2047:     ok = file:make_dir(TargetDir),
 2048: 
 2049:     {ok,_} = compile:file(File, [dssaopt, {outdir, TargetDir}]),
 2050:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(Listing),
 2051:     Lines = string:split(binary_to_list(Data), "\n", all),
 2052:     ResultTypes = get_result_types(Lines),
 2053:     io:format("Calls: ~p~n", [ResultTypes]),
 2054: 
 2055:     TypesToCheck = [{make_atom, "'an_atom'"},
 2056:                     {make_number, "number()"},
 2057:                     {make_float, "3.14"},
 2058:                     {make_integer, "17"},
 2059:                     {make_integer_range, "0..3"},
 2060:                     {make_nil, "nil()"},
 2061:                     {make_list, "list(any())"},
 2062:                     {make_list_of_ints, "list(integer())"},
 2063:                     {make_maybe_improper_list,
 2064:                      "maybe_improper_list(any(), any())"},
 2065:                     {make_nonempty_list, "nonempty_list(any())"},
 2066:                     {make_nonempty_improper_list,
 2067:                      "nonempty_improper_list(any(), ''end'')"},
 2068:                     {make_empty_map, "#{}"},
 2069:                     {make_map, "map()"},
 2070:                     {make_map_known_types, "#{integer()=>float()}"},
 2071:                     {make_fun_unknown_arity_known_type,
 2072:                      "fun((...) -> number())"},
 2073:                     {make_fun_known_arity_known_type,
 2074:                      "fun((_, _) -> number())"},
 2075:                     {make_fun_unknown_arity_unknown_type,
 2076:                      "fun()"},
 2077:                     {make_fun_known_arity_unknown_type,
 2078:                      "fun((_, _))"},
 2079:                     {make_unconstrained_tuple, "{...}"},
 2080:                     {make_known_size_tuple,
 2081:                      "{any(), any(), any(), any(), any()}"},
 2082:                     {make_inexact_tuple, "{any(), any(), any(), ...}"},
 2083:                     {make_union,
 2084:                      "'foo' | nonempty_list(1..3) | number(3, 7) |"
 2085:                      " {'tag0', 1, 2} | {'tag1', 3, 4} | bitstring(8)"},
 2086:                     {make_bitstring, "bitstring(8)"},
 2087:                     {make_none, "none()"}],
 2088:     lists:foreach(fun({FunName, Expected}) ->
 2089:                           Actual = map_get(atom_to_list(FunName), ResultTypes),
 2090:                           case Actual of
 2091:                               Expected ->
 2092:                                   ok;
 2093:                               _ ->
 2094:                                   ct:fail("Expected type of ~p is ~s, found ~s",
 2095:                                           [FunName, Expected, Actual])
 2096:                           end
 2097:                   end, TypesToCheck),
 2098:     ok = file:del_dir_r(TargetDir),
 2099:     ok.
 2100: 
 2101: %% Parsing for result types. Remember the last seen "Result type"
 2102: %% annotation and apply it to calls when we see them to a call when we
 2103: %% see them.
 2104: get_result_types(Lines) ->
 2105:     get_result_types(Lines, none, #{}).
 2106: 
 2107: get_result_types(["  %% Result type:"++_,"  %%    "++TypeLine|Lines], _, Acc) ->
 2108:     get_result_types(Lines, TypeLine, Acc);
 2109: get_result_types([Line|Lines], TypeLine, Acc0) ->
 2110:     Split = string:split(Line, "="),
 2111:     Acc = case Split of
 2112:               [_, " call" ++ Rest] ->
 2113:                   case string:split(Rest, "`", all) of
 2114:                       [_,Callee,_] ->
 2115:                           Acc0#{ Callee => TypeLine };
 2116:                       _ ->
 2117:                           Acc0
 2118:                   end;
 2119:               _ ->
 2120:                   Acc0
 2121:           end,
 2122:     get_result_types(Lines, TypeLine, Acc);
 2123: get_result_types([], _, Acc) ->
 2124:     Acc.
 2125: 
 2126: %% Check that the beam_ssa_type pass knows about bs_init_writable.
 2127: bs_init_writable(Config) ->
 2128:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2129:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2130:     InFile = filename:join(DataDir, "bs_init_writable.erl"),
 2131:     OutDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "bs_init_writable"),
 2132:     OutFile = filename:join(OutDir, "bs_init_writable.S"),
 2133:     ok = file:make_dir(OutDir),
 2134:     {ok,bs_init_writable} = compile:file(InFile, ['S',{outdir,OutDir}]),
 2135:     {ok,Listing} = file:read_file(OutFile),
 2136:     Os = [global,multiline,{capture,all_but_first,list}],
 2137:     %% The is_bitstr test should be optimized away.
 2138:     nomatch = re:run(Listing, "({test,is_bitstr,.+})", Os),
 2139:     %% The is_bitstr test should be optimized away.
 2140:     nomatch = re:run(Listing, "({test,is_binary,.+})", Os),
 2141:     ok = file:del_dir_r(OutDir).
 2142: 
 2143: 
 2144: %% Check that an SSA listing contains pretty printed annotations, this
 2145: %% blindly checks that the expected annotation occurs the expected
 2146: %% number of times. Checking that the annotations are correctly placed
 2147: %% and contains the correct information is done in
 2148: %% beam_ssa_check_SUITE.
 2149: annotations_pp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2150:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2151:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2152:     TargetDir = filename:join(PrivDir, types_pp),
 2153:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "annotations_pp.erl"),
 2154:     Listing = filename:join(TargetDir, "annotations_pp.ssaopt"),
 2155:     ok = file:make_dir(TargetDir),
 2156: 
 2157:     {ok,_} = compile:file(File, [dssaopt, {outdir, TargetDir}]),
 2158:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(Listing),
 2159:     Lines = string:split(binary_to_list(Data), "\n", all),
 2160: 
 2161:     ResultTypes = get_annotations("  %% Result type:", Lines),
 2162:     10 = length(ResultTypes),
 2163: 
 2164:     Uniques = get_annotations("  %% Unique:", Lines),
 2165:     10 = length(Uniques),
 2166: 
 2167:     Aliased = get_annotations("  %% Aliased:", Lines),
 2168:     13 = length(Aliased),
 2169: 
 2170:     ok = file:del_dir_r(TargetDir),
 2171:     ok.
 2172: 
 2173: get_annotations(Key, [Key,"  %%    "++Anno|Lines]) ->
 2174:     [Anno|get_annotations(Key, Lines)];
 2175: get_annotations(Key, [_|Lines]) ->
 2176:     get_annotations(Key, Lines);
 2177: get_annotations(_, []) ->
 2178:     [].
 2179: 
 2180: option_order(Config) ->
 2181:     Ts = [{spec1,
 2182:            ~"""
 2183:             -compile(nowarn_missing_spec).
 2184:             foo() -> ok.
 2185:             """,
 2186:            [],                                  %Environment
 2187:            [warn_missing_spec],
 2188:            []},
 2189:           {spec2,
 2190:            ~"""
 2191:             foo() -> ok.
 2192:             """,
 2193:            [{"ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "warn_missing_spec"}],
 2194:            [nowarn_missing_spec],
 2195:            []},
 2196:           {spec3,
 2197:            ~"""
 2198:             -compile(nowarn_missing_spec).
 2199:             foo() -> ok.
 2200:             """,
 2201:            [{"ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "nowarn_missing_spec"}],
 2202:            [warn_missing_spec],
 2203:            []},
 2204:           {spec4,
 2205:            ~"""
 2206:             -compile(warn_missing_spec).
 2207:             foo() -> ok.
 2208:             """,
 2209:            [{"ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "nowarn_missing_spec"}],
 2210:            [],
 2211:            {warnings,[{{2,1},erl_lint,{missing_spec,{foo,0}}}]}
 2212:           },
 2213:           {spec5,
 2214:            ~"""
 2215:             -compile([warn_missing_spec,nowarn_missing_spec]).
 2216:             foo() -> ok.
 2217:             """,
 2218:            [{"ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "nowarn_missing_spec"}],
 2219:            [warn_missing_spec],
 2220:            []},
 2221:           {records1,
 2222:            ~"""
 2223:             -record(r, {x,y}).
 2224:             rec_test(#r{x=X,y=Y}) -> X + Y.
 2225:             """,
 2226:            [],
 2227:            [strict_record_tests],
 2228:            fun(M) ->
 2229:                    try M:rec_test({r,1,2,3}) of
 2230:                        3 ->
 2231:                            fail()
 2232:                    catch
 2233:                        error:function_clause ->
 2234:                            ok
 2235:                    end
 2236:            end},
 2237:           {records2,
 2238:            ~"""
 2239:             -record(r, {x,y}).
 2240:             rec_test(R) -> R#r.x + R#r.y.
 2241:             """,
 2242:            [],
 2243:            [no_strict_record_tests],
 2244:            fun(M) ->
 2245:                    3 = M:rec_test({r,1,2,3}),
 2246:                    ok
 2247:            end},
 2248:           {records3,
 2249:            ~"""
 2250:             -compile(no_strict_record_tests).
 2251:             -record(r, {x,y}).
 2252:             rec_test(R) -> R#r.x + R#r.y.
 2253:             """,
 2254:            [],
 2255:            [strict_record_tests],
 2256:            fun(M) ->
 2257:                    3 = M:rec_test({r,1,2,3}),
 2258:                    ok
 2259:            end},
 2260:           {records4,
 2261:            ~"""
 2262:             -record(r, {x,y}).
 2263:             rec_test(#r{x=X,y=Y}) -> X + Y.
 2264:             """,
 2265:            [{"ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "strict_record_tests"}],
 2266:            [],
 2267:            fun(M) ->
 2268:                    try M:rec_test({r,1,2,3}) of
 2269:                        3 ->
 2270:                            fail()
 2271:                    catch
 2272:                        error:function_clause ->
 2273:                            ok
 2274:                    end
 2275:            end},
 2276:           {records5,
 2277:            ~"""
 2278:             -record(r, {x,y}).
 2279:             rec_test(R) -> R#r.x + R#r.y.
 2280:             """,
 2281:            [{"ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "strict_record_tests"}],
 2282:            [no_strict_record_tests],
 2283:            fun(M) ->
 2284:                    3 = M:rec_test({r,1,2,3}),
 2285:                    ok
 2286:            end},
 2287:           {records6,
 2288:            ~"""
 2289:             -compile(no_strict_record_tests).
 2290:             -record(r, {x,y}).
 2291:             rec_test(R) -> R#r.x + R#r.y.
 2292:             """,
 2293:            [{"ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "strict_record_tests"}],
 2294:            [],
 2295:            fun(M) ->
 2296:                    3 = M:rec_test({r,1,2,3}),
 2297:                    ok
 2298:            end},
 2299:           {records7,
 2300:            ~"""
 2301:             -record(r, {x,y}).
 2302:             rec_test(R) -> R#r.x + R#r.y.
 2303:             """,
 2304:            [{"ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "no_strict_record_tests"}],
 2305:            [no_strict_record_tests, strict_record_tests],
 2306:            fun(M) ->
 2307:                    try M:rec_test({r,1,2,3}) of
 2308:                        3 ->
 2309:                            fail()
 2310:                    catch
 2311:                        error:{badrecord,{r,1,2,3}} ->
 2312:                            ok
 2313:                    end
 2314:            end}
 2315: 
 2316:          ],
 2317:     run(Config, Ts),
 2318:     ok.
 2319: 
 2320: %%%
 2321: %%% Utilities.
 2322: %%%
 2323: 
 2324: compile_and_verify(Name, Target, Opts) ->
 2325:     Mod = list_to_atom(filename:basename(Name, ".erl")),
 2326:     {ok,Mod} = compile:file(Name, Opts),
 2327:     {ok,{Mod,[{compile_info,CInfo}]}} = 
 2328: 	beam_lib:chunks(Target, [compile_info]),
 2329:     {options,BeamOpts} = lists:keyfind(options, 1, CInfo),
 2330:     Opts = BeamOpts.
 2331: 
 2332: get_unique_beam_files() ->
 2333:     get_unique_files(".beam").
 2334: 
 2335: get_unique_files(Ext) ->
 2336:     Wc = filename:join(filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)), "*"++Ext),
 2337:     [F || F <- filelib:wildcard(Wc),
 2338: 	  not is_cloned(F, Ext), not is_lfe_module(F, Ext)].
 2339: 
 2340: is_cloned(File, Ext) ->
 2341:     Mod = list_to_atom(filename:basename(File, Ext)),
 2342:     test_lib:is_cloned_mod(Mod).
 2343: 
 2344: is_lfe_module(File, Ext) ->
 2345:     case filename:basename(File, Ext) of
 2346: 	"lfe_" ++ _ -> true;
 2347: 	_ -> false
 2348:     end.
 2349: 
 2350: %% Compiles a test module and returns the list of errors and warnings.
 2351: 
 2352: run(Config, Tests) ->
 2353:     F = fun({N,P,Env,Ws,Run}, _BadL) when is_function(Run, 1) ->
 2354:                 case catch run_test(Config, P, Env, Ws, Run) of
 2355:                     ok ->
 2356:                         ok;
 2357:                     Bad ->
 2358:                         io:format("~nTest ~p failed. Expected~n  ~p~n"
 2359:                                   "but got~n  ~p~n", [N, ok, Bad]),
 2360:                         fail()
 2361:                 end;
 2362:            ({N,P,Env,Ws,Expected}, BadL)
 2363:               when is_list(Expected); is_tuple(Expected) ->
 2364:                 io:format("### ~s\n", [N]),
 2365:                 case catch run_test(Config, P, Env, Ws, none) of
 2366:                     Expected ->
 2367:                         BadL;
 2368:                     Bad ->
 2369:                         io:format("~nTest ~p failed. Expected~n  ~p~n"
 2370:                                   "but got~n  ~p~n", [N, Expected, Bad]),
 2371: 			fail()
 2372:                 end
 2373:         end,
 2374:     lists:foldl(F, [], Tests).
 2375: 
 2376: run_test(Conf, Test0, Env, Options, Run) ->
 2377:     run_test_putenv(Env),
 2378:     Module = "warnings" ++ test_lib:uniq(),
 2379:     Filename = Module ++ ".erl",
 2380:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Conf),
 2381:     Test1 = ["-module(", Module, "). -file( \"", Filename, "\", 1). ", Test0],
 2382:     Test = iolist_to_binary(Test1),
 2383:     File = filename:join(DataDir, Filename),
 2384:     Opts = [binary,export_all,return|Options],
 2385:     ok = file:write_file(File, Test),
 2386: 
 2387:     %% Compile once just to print all warnings (and cover more code).
 2388:     _ = compile:file(File, [binary,export_all,report|Options]),
 2389: 
 2390:     %% Test result of compilation.
 2391:     {ok, Mod, Beam, Warnings} = compile:file(File, Opts),
 2392:     _ = file:delete(File),
 2393: 
 2394:     if
 2395:         is_function(Run, 1) ->
 2396:             {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Beam),
 2397:             ok = Run(Mod),
 2398:             run_test_unsetenv(Env),
 2399:             true = code:delete(Mod),
 2400:             _ = code:purge(Mod),
 2401:             ok;
 2402:         Run =:= none ->
 2403:             run_test_unsetenv(Env),
 2404:             Res = get_warnings(Warnings),
 2405:             case Res of
 2406:                 [] ->
 2407:                     [];
 2408:                 {warnings, Ws} ->
 2409:                     print_warnings(Ws, Test),
 2410:                     Res
 2411:             end
 2412:     end.
 2413: 
 2414: run_test_putenv(Env) ->
 2415:     _ = [_ = os:putenv(Name, Value) || {Name,Value} <- Env],
 2416:     ok.
 2417: 
 2418: run_test_unsetenv(Env) ->
 2419:     _ = [_ = os:unsetenv(Name) || {Name,_Value} <- Env],
 2420:     ok.
 2421: 
 2422: get_warnings([]) ->
 2423:     [];
 2424: get_warnings(WsL) ->
 2425:     case WsL of
 2426:         [{_File,Ws}] -> {warnings, Ws};
 2427:         _ -> {warnings, WsL}
 2428:     end.
 2429: 
 2430: print_warnings(Warnings, Source) ->
 2431:     Lines = binary:split(Source, <<"\n">>, [global]),
 2432:     Cs = [print_warning(W, Lines) || W <- Warnings],
 2433:     io:put_chars(Cs),
 2434:     ok.
 2435: 
 2436: print_warning({{LineNum,Column},Mod,Data}, Lines) ->
 2437:     Line0 = lists:nth(LineNum, Lines),
 2438:     <<Line1:(Column-1)/binary,_/binary>> = Line0,
 2439:     Spaces = re:replace(Line1, <<"[^\t]">>, <<" ">>, [global]),
 2440:     CaretLine = [Spaces,"^"],
 2441:     [io_lib:format("~p:~p: ~ts\n",
 2442:                    [LineNum,Column,Mod:format_error(Data)]),
 2443:      Line0, "\n",
 2444:      CaretLine, "\n\n"];
 2445: print_warning(_, _) ->
 2446:     [].
 2447: 
 2448: fail() ->
 2449:     ct:fail(failed).
